1.content:
"Isabelle dear," the Queen called to her daughter from the doorway. "Are you awake yet?" As she opened the curtains to let the sun drench the room in light she glanced in the direction of her daughter's bed and realized that she was no where to be seen.

~*~*~*~*~*~

Meanwhile, outside in the stables were two teenagers having fun. The girl, who was wearing some ratty old clothes, had her long black hair tied in a messy bun, and was covered in filth, would have been very beautiful if she were cleaner and wearing nice clothes. "Come on Daniel, lets go riding. I bet I could beat you in a race again."

"Oh, I was just letting you win," he replied as he readied two horses for riding. Daniel was wearing equally ratty clothes, for he was the stable boy and none of his clothes were any nicer. However, despite his tattered appearance he was still quite attractive.

"Oh really, then what about all the other times I've beaten you?"

"That was just luck. I'll beat you this time," he teased her as he handed the reins of one of the horses to her.

"We'll just see about that," she laughed as she pushed him down and swung her leg over the horse's back. "Ready, set, GO!"

"Hey no fair," he jumped onto his horse and chased after her.
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
He had finally caught up to her and was about to cross the finish line when they both heard a voice that stopped them dead in their tracks. "ISABELLE! What in the world do you think you're doing!? Get off that horse and into some decent clothing."

"Oh great, race called on account of my mother," Isabelle whispered under her breath. Daniel tried to stiffle a giggle.

"What was that young lady?"

"Nothing mother," as she showed Daniel a funny face then put on a polite smile for her mother.

"I would have beaten you if it wasn't for your mother," gloated Daniel while he hopped off his horse and went to help Isabelle down.

"No you wouldn't have, I was just letting you catch up."

"Stop dawdling Isabelle."

"Sorry Mother."

"And you Daniel, you should know better than to indulge a young princess like that."

"Sorry your Majesty."

"I'll sneak out later and we can finish this race, Daniel."
11.title: A Draw

111.content:
It was a daily event that Princess Isabelle would disappear and be found later on in the company of the stable boy, Daniel. Her parents, King Edward and Queen Jasmine, were beginning to worry. "She is a royal princess and she is always off galavanting with the boy."

"First off Edward, she is a teenager, and she is a wild spirit who will not be contained. And second, Daniel is near the age of manhood and he is very responsible."

"Now Jasmine, I know you are fond of the boy, but the point is that she is almost of marrying age and we need to find her a suitor. We need to get her to attend balls and dinners."

"I know, I know, but she is still our daughter and we should atleast try and think about what she wants. But you are right. We'll have to sit her down and explain all this to her. She's a reasonable young lady and she'll understand.

~*~*~*~*~

Meanwhile, unbeknowst to the King and Queen, Isabelle was standing on the otherside of the door and had heard everything. She was not happy, she ran straight up to her room and did not emerge for hours. When she finally did she ran straight to Daniel.

"Isabelle, whats wrong?" he asked her dropping what he was doing looking extremely concerned for her.

"It's nothing," she lied as she wiped the tears off her face. "But look, I found this book about this treasure see. Supposedly, there is a lot of gold and not only that but somethings of the gods. There are things like a holy sword and armor, a magic mirror, fruit of the gods, and so much more. Come on let's go, let's go and find it. I'm already packed."

He was dumbstruck. She wanted to go on this dangerous and probably deadly quest for some mythical treasure. "But you can't, your parents would never let you go."

"I don't need their permission to do this. I'm going whether they want me to or not. They don't even have to know about it."

"But you're just one person, you're a princess, how do you expect to get there and back."

"Well, I was hoping you would come with me. Help me out."

"I can't Isabelle. It's one thing to let you ride horses and to disobey your parents around here, but that's too far, that's where I draw the line."

"And I thought you wanted to be a knight."

"I do, but..."

"No buts. No knight would let a princess go off on such a dangerous quest alone. And if we pull this off they'll have no choice but to make you a knight, and I can finally get some freedom. Now are you coming or not."

"Just give me a few minutes to pack."

By the late afternoon they were heading off on their quest. They had packed up the few things they would need and left without saying goodbye to anyone.
111.title: The Quest

1111.content:
"Isabelle, it's time for dinner. You haven't been out of your room all day, now come out dear," Queen Jasmine called through the door, but when there was no reply she opened the door and saw that Isabelle had disappeared again.

For the next hour and a half the Queen and several servants searched for her but when they found no sign of her Queen Jasmine became hysterical and ran into Isabelle's room crying, "Where is she!? Where is my daughter!?"

After frantically searching the room, she came across a note telling of a quest. The Queen ran to her husband waving the note in his face. The moment he read the note he sent for his best knights. He would have sent his whole army to bring her back, but he was at war with a neighboring kingdom and could only spare a few knights. So he sent the wisest, bravest, strongest, quickest, and most well travelled knights.
1111.title: A Note

choices: Go down the path to the village
Go down the path to into the forest
11111.content:
Isabelle and Daniel had been walking for awhile in complete silence and it was starting to get some what uncomfortable. Even though they were best friends neither knew what to say to the other.

~*~*~*~*~*~

Meanwhile, back at the castle, five knights were setting out to find the princess. "Can you believe we've been sent off on this wild goose chase?" asked the first.

"Yeah I know, we should be with the others fighting the war, not off chasing after some silly little girl with dreams of being some hero or warrior princess," replied a second.

"Hey look at it this way," suggested a third. "It's a nice break from real work. She's obviously not going to get very far, so we get to take our time and relax. This is just a paid vacation."

"That's right, and might I remind you guys that she is not just some silly little girl anymore. Have none of you seen Princess Isabelle lately? She has grown up, and mmm mmm mmm does she look good," said the fourth.

"Be quiet all of you," interrupted the fifth, who until now had said nothing since they had left. "First of all, she is only sixteen and a princess, you shouldn't be talking about her like that. Second, this is not a vacation, have all of you forgotten about Radigan?" The joy suddenly left all the knights faces, they had forgotten about Radigan. "He is still after the kingdom, and she is his ticket in. I don't want to imagine what he might do to her."

~*~*~*~*~

Finally the silence was broken with the realization that neither Isabelle nor Daniel knew where they were going.

"Isabelle?"

"Yeah?"

"Do you know where were going?"

The look of fear on her face answered his question. "Don't worry Isabelle, we'll figure out what to do," he reasured her. "Look, you said that book told all about this treasure. Maybe there's a map."

"Oh you're right, thank goodness you're here Daniel. Here's the book," she replied handing him the book. Just then they came upon a fork in the road. One path led to a quaint little village and the other led into a dark forest. "Which way does the book say to go Daniel?"

"Hmm, let me see. Oh great, the book talks in riddles. It says, 'VERY FEW HAVE EMBARKED UPON AND NONE HAVE SURVIVED THIS QUEST. TO A RICH AND BRIGHT FUTURE, DOWN THE POETIC PATH IS THE BEST.' What do you think it means?"

"Umm, lets go this way."
11111.title: Fork in the Road

choices: The villagers come out of hiding and attack them
111111.content:
"It's this way," Isabelle concluded starting down the path to the village.

Daniel was a little more skeptical and remained at the fork in the road," Are you sure its that way?"

"Of course I'm sure. Poets always write about quaint little villages. Why would they write about something as ugly as the forest?" she called over her shoulder without stopping or looking back.

Comfortable with you reasoning, Daniel followed. When he finally caught up to her he was suprised by her poking him in the side and laughing at him.

"Ow, what was that for?" She just kept laughing until he poked her in her side causing her to squeak and him to snort through his laughter. In return, she pushed him, he push her, and they continued to poke and push each other until their laughter got in the way. The laughed all the rest of the way to the village, but when they got there, they realized that something was wrong. There was no one around, not one single villager in sight.
111111.title: The Village

1111111.content:
As Isabelle and Daniel walked into the village and looked around they couldn't find anyone. It was as if everyone had suddenly vanished in the middle of whatever they were all doing.

It wasn't until they reached the village square that either of them said a word, "Well, Isabelle," Daniel said. "I guess we should probably set up camp, it will be dark..." He suddenly stopped for seemingly no reason.

"What is it Daniel?" Isabelle was getting increasingly worried, but she knew that Daniel would protect her. Besides, she knew how to defend herself. She had been helping Daniel train to become a knight for years and was very skilled at using a sword, although she was much better at a bow and arrow.

Suddenly Daniel pushed Isabelle aside and jumped infront of her. Before she even saw what was happening she heard the sounds of steel on steel. She stood with her back towards Daniel as more and more villagers began coming out of nowhere to attack them. As a villager lunged at her with his sword poised to strike she ducked out of the way and kicked his sword out of his hand. She looked for Daniel and saw him fighting several other villagers and knew that she would have to fight. So as another villager charged at her Isabelle dove for the fallen sword, grabbed it, and before she could even rise to her feet she turned around bringing the sword above her head to deflect the sword looming down upon her. His and her sword met in a loud crash of steel on steel. She quickly leapt to her feet to fight off the now numerous villagers closing in on her.

Daniel and Isabelle continued to fight valiantly and were now back to back and completely surrounded when a very comanding voice rang throughout the village ceasing the battle. A pathway through the villagers formed to let the person whose voice comanded so much respect pass through. As the person came into view Daniel and Isabelle were suprised to see...
1111111.title: Attacked

choices: accept and stay at his house for the night
find elsewhere to stay or continue on your way on through the night
11111111.content:
Walking towards them was a man around late 30s. He looked very strong and he seemed to be either revered or feared by the villagers. His voice was deep and smooth and everyone seemed to hold their breaths as he spoke, "There will be no more blood shed. You must excuse us, we do not get visitor often and they are usually malevolent, and with Radigan on the rise we must be extra careful." Daniel and Isabelle just nodded, not sure what to make of this mn standing before them. "Oh, excuse me for not introducing myself. My name is Deeter."

"Hi, I'm Daniel."

"And I'm Isabelle, its nice to meet you."

"That's a pretty name Isabelle," Deeter replied. "You know, the princess has that very same name."

"Yeah I get that a lot."

Daniel just looked at her wondering why she didn't say that she WAS the princess. With a look she silenced him though.

"Are you travelling far," Deeter questioned.

"Oh, yeah. We have quite a ways to go," Daniel answered.

"Well, it'll be dark soon, and you shouldn't be meandering about that late. Do you need a place to stay until morning. I have a couple spare rooms if you want. And my daughter, who should be about your age, can show you around town and help you find anything you may need for your trip. What do you say?"
11111111.title: Deeter

choices: go in and get ready for bed
go meet some of the neighbors
111111111.content:
"We accept, thank you very much," Isabelle answered. Daniel smiled and nodded.

"Excellent," Deeter replied. "Lucia, where are you? Ah, there you are Lucia, come over here." A lovely young woman about 16 came over. She was little taller than Isabelle, had curly red shoulder length hair, and was just about as beautiful as Isabelle. "This is my daughter," Deeter continued, "Lucia. She will show you two my home and to the rooms you may stay in."

"Thanks Deeter," Daniel said, "Hello Lucia." He took her hand in his and kissed it.

"Its a pleasure to meet you Lucia," Isabelle took Lucia's hand from Daniel and shook it. "I'm Isabelle and this is Daniel."

"The pleasures mine. Now if you follow me I will show you to my home, and on the way I can point out some places where you may be able to find some supplies for your journey."

"Thank you," Daniel and Isabelle responded falling in step behind Lucia.

"Right over here is the home of Mr. and Mrs. Palonis. Mrs. Palonis is always cooking, if you ever get hungry you can visit her, but you may gain a little more weight than you might want. Also, if you need any food for you trip she'll be glad to give you some. There is where Mr. Gilani lives. He has a son who lives quite a ways away and sends him many items from the places he's been. Also they visit each other every now and then, so Mr. Gilani has lots of travelling supplies. Mr. Tomin lives right here, and he's the best hunter in our village. He can give you some tips for hunting, meat, hunting supplies, etc. Over there by the edge of the forest lives old lady Haverstein. She doesn't come out very often. She is both feared and respected by all the villagers. She is somewhat of a mystic. The little kids like to call her a witch, she dabbles in magics, has some potions, and such, but she's a sweet old lady when you get to know her. Ah, here we are home sweet home. This is my father's and my house."

They had arrrived at a quiant little two story house, it looked almost identical to all the other houses in the village, with the exception of old lady Haverstein's, but there were some subtle differences to it.
111111111.title: The Neighbors

choices: In the middle of the night
1111111111.content:
Lucia showed them upstairs to their rooms. Their rooms looked basically the same, they were right across the hall from each other with a bathroom at the end of the hall. After repeatedly asking if there was anything they need, Lucia finally went downstairs and left them alone. They went into Isabelle's room and sat on the bed to talk.

"Hey, Isabelle," Daniel began, "I've been meaning to ask you."

"Yeah Daniel."

"Why didn't you tell them that you're the princess?"

"Oh that. Well, I just wanted to be able to go around and be treated normally. All my life people have been treating me different and walking on eggshells around me afraid that they'll do something wrong and be killed for it. Besides, I kind of think Deeter already knows."

"Yeah, it did look like he knew about it, but atleast he did't say anything," Daniel agreed. "So, maybe tomorrow we should talk to some of those neighbors, its sounds like they may be able to give us some stuff we may need."

"Yeah, I agree," Isabelle said standing up. "It's getting late, and we have a lot to do tomorrow."

"Oh yeah. Good night Isabelle." Daniel got up, walked over to his room and shut the door. He took off his clothes, he liked to sleep in just his shorts, and got under the covers. He was asleep the moment his head hit hit the pillow.

"Good night Daniel," Isabelle called through Daniel's door just before closing hers. She slipped out of her dress and since she forgot to pack something to sleep in, she got into bed wearing just her under garments. She wasn't that tired so she layed in bed a few moments before she finally driftd into sleep.

~*~*~*~*~*~

"Good night my little children," Radigan muttered. He had been watching Isabelle's and Daniel's progress a swirling orb which he could make to spy on whoever he wanted it to. "Ha ha ha. They're playing right into my hands. I'll never allow them to get that treasure, but I think I'll wait long enough to find the location of the treasure so that I may get it for myself. Then I will have all its power and weapons and I will have almost no use for Princess Isabelle. However, I would like to keep her for myself. She is a beautiful young woman. That Daniel boy I can just destroy, or pehaps I can use him. I can practice my new powers and weapons on him. Ha ha ha. Soon it will al be mine. Ha ha ha ha ha."
1111111111.title: Good Night

11111111111.content:
That morning when Daniel and Isabelle woke up, they decided to go visit some of the other villagers after they had a small breakfast with Deeter and Lucia.

First they visited Mr. and Mrs. Palonis where they were fed a very large second breakfast. Mrs. Palonis was a very jovial plump woman who doted upon them and packed them both a bag filled with food for their trip. Mr. Palonis was equally as jovial and yet surprisingly scinny considering how much Mrs. Paloni loved to cooked. While his wife began cooking another meal for them, Mr. Palonis was able to sneak Isabelle and Daniel out of the house before they gained too much weight.

Next they visited Mr. Gilani whose son travelled the world and sent him several rare items from the places he had gone. Every so often his son was somewhere close enough for Mr. Gilani to visit him, but since he never knew when that was going to happen he kept surplus travelling supplies which he was only too happy to share. He also gave them a few rare items that they could use for trading.

After they left Mr. Gilani's they visited Mr. Tomin, a very strong and rugged looking man. Isabelle didn't like him that much because he put too much emphasis on how a man is supposed to be strong and be able to take care of the 'little woman'. However, he did give them, or rather Daniel, a couple small daggers, a bow, and some arrows. Along with Daniel's sword they were well equipped.

They had been given so many things by the friendly villagers that they needed to get a couple new bags from Deeter and Lucia. Deeter and Lucia were so generous, they even almost gave Daniel and Isabelle their two horses, but they graciously declined feeling a little guilty at how much they had already been given.

While packing their bags Isabelle found the book that had sent them on this trip. She had completely forgotten about it. So she opened it up and she and Daniel were surprised to see a picture of the village, along with a small riddle.

'VISITING THE WOMAN WHO MAKES THE POTION,
TO AID IN YOUR QUEST IS A VERY GOOD NOTION.'
11111111111.title: Visiting

choices: Daniel and Isabelle leave her house
111111111111.content:
"Well, this book hasn't steered us wrong yet, and it lead us to all these generous people. I say we trust it and visit old lady Haverstein," Daniel suggested.

"I agree." They went to the old looking house and when they knocked the door swung open. After taking a quick look inside Daniel and Isabelle entered with the door slamming shut behind them. Soon they saw a desk in a room lit by a few scattered candles with an old woman sitting at it.

"Princess Isabelle, Daniel, I've been waiting for you. I wasn't sure if you would heed the book in your possession," her voice was soft, almost inaudible, and very soothing.

"But how did you know we were coming?" Daniel asked.

"How did you know I'm a princess? I haven't told anyone in town that."

"My child, how could I not know? I already know why you are here and where you are going. I have some gifts for you." Daniel and Isabelle suddenly noticed that she never looked directly at them. The blank look in her eyes told them that she was blind, but they could tell that she had some other way of seeing. They weren't sure how, but it was there.

"Old la-Miss Haverstein. You said you had some things for us. What kind of things?" Daniel inquired.

"Ah, yes. These will aid you on your quest," she turned around and reached into the cabinet behind her pulling out object after object. She held up each one in turn as she explained what they were then put them in a pack. "This my dears is a healing potion. You simply drip a couple drops on the wound, get some rest, and soon it will be healed. If there is interior damage, drink a few drops. I'm sorry to say that it does not cure a broken heart. Next we have an enchanted cloak. It can protect you from many attacks, fire, several bladed weapons, and most spells, but not all so be careful. This sheild is also enchanted. Not only is it extremely stong and can deflect most weapons, but it also increases all of your abilities. Here is a bow that any arrow shot from it will not fail to miss its mark. These seeds need only be planted and sprinkled with a little water and they will grow immediately. Each seed will give you enough food to last you a day. This key is capable of opening any locked door. Here I have two pendents that if you two are seperated can help you find each other. A small map of the area will appear on the back that will show where the other pendent is. When they get close enough they will begin to glow and once you are reunited the glowing will stop." Miss Haverstein gave them a few more supplies. Daniel and Isabelle thanked her for all the amzing gifts that she was giving them no questions asks.
111111111111.title: Gifts

1111111111112.content:
"Well, we still want to take a look around town. Thank you Miss Haverstein," Daniel thanked her.

"Yes thank you. Good bye," Isabelle chimed in. They turned around and walked out the front door.

"Good bye children," Miss Haverstein called after them as she looked after them, her eyes, blind no more, watching them leave. "They are strong, and will not be easily detered by you." A dark form came out of the shadows.

"They are but mere children. How long do you think your's or any other's magic will shield them from me?"

"Radigan, you are a fool. Those who protect them do not use any magic that you can break. Their powers come from the days of old that have long been forgotten. We may not be able to keep them safe forever, but they will be given a generous head start," she answered.

"You are the fools. Even with all you powers none of you were able to stop me, and now you send children to put an end to my rein. Ha, I am all powerful and not even the little treasure chest they search for will contain anything to stop me."

"As I said, there are powers in the world far greater than your's. They are the ancient powers, and there is enough magic in the 'little treasure chest' to stop you one hundred fold. As for these children, their destinies are great. They will accomplish wonderful things in their time, and will leave the world a much better place free of you and several other evils." After staring at the doorway refusing to look at Radigan, Miss Haverstein brought her eyes to his as she said her last sentenced. An angered, and slightly worried Radigan snapped his fingers and disappeared in a blinding flash with a loud bang, leaving behind nothing but a small cloud of smoke.

Meanwhile, outside Daniel and Isabelle are...
1111111111112.title: Powers

choices: The mask is pulled away to reveal the evil magician
The mask is pulled away to reveal a local man
11111111111121.content:
Isabelle blinked as she emerged from the dim hut back into the bright day. As Daniel came to her side, she looped an arm through his, and hugged it briefly.
"Wow. Such an adventure already. All these magic potions, and these tools . . . it's like book from my father's library."
Daniel's handsome face looked worried. Isabelle hadn't made mention of it when they arose, but Daniel, after he had washed that morning, had emerged as a striking figure of a man. It had taken a moment for Isabelle to recall that this was her friend Daniel, the stable boy, for heaven's sake.
"Something doesn't feel right." He said, shifting the load he wore on his back. "It felt like there was someone there. Watching us." He ran a hand through his hair.
Isabelle shook her head. "Where? There was barely enough room for you and I in there."
A blast of sound from the other side of the square interrupted their conversation, and together they peered across the cobblestones. Some sort of raised structure had been erected, and there was a crowd already around it. Daniel and Isabelle joined the throng, but stayed at the back.
"We should be on our way." Daniel murmurred in her ear.
"Hush. We'll go once we figure out what's going on." Isabelle's eyes were trained on the stage.
Suddenly, in a whirl of colour, a dozen figures burst though the curtain and onto the stage. After a few moments, Isabelle realized what it was. "A festival!" She cried, her eyes shining. She applauded excitedly. "Oh, how fun! Daniel! A festival!"
The crowd around her were all equally excited, and music arose from around the square. Turning, Daniel could see figures streaming out from all the streets and alleys into the square. These tumblers and acrobats began to go through the crowd, and suddenly, the square was awash in light and sound, as the entire community began to dance with these figures. He whirled when he heard Isabelle laugh, just in time to see her dragged into a fast dance with a masked jester. He moved to catch up with her, only to have his own hands clasped. He turned and saw another masked figure, female this time, grinning up at him.
"Come, young man," She said, and whirled him around quickly. "Dance with me."
Although he tried desperately to keep an eye on Isabelle, it was futile. He finally made it to the edge of the crowd, found a place in the shadows, and watched carefully the whirling figures, hopeing to catch sight of her.
Suddenly, the air turned cold, and the music dies with a snap. Daniel started forward, only to catch sight of the figures on the stage. One, he recognized easily - Isabelle, still grinning widely, having the time of her life. The other figure was dressed as a jester, his rags of bright cloth seeming at odds with his regal bearing. Daniel began to elbow his way through the crowd, ignoring the mutters and curses in his wake.
"Behold!" cried the jester on the stage. "This young lady of the town, has volunteered to be my assitant today." A smattering of applause from the audience, and a rude whistle from the vicinity of the ale-house was the reaction. "I see you are not sufficiently enthused by this," the jester continued, the eyes through the slits of the mask narrowing, "so, I, a great magician, shall only do one trick for you." A series of groans arose from the audience. "Ah! More than one trick then?" A cheer arose. "Very well."
Suddenly, a crash, almost of thunder sounded above the crowd, and there were squeals of surprise as a shower of coloured sparks fell upon them.
"Not enough?" Called the magician, and suddenly, huge jets of green tinged smoke arose from the sides of the stage, accompanied by music - all eyes turned to the musicians - who were all in the ale house, their intruments abandoned.
As the magician continued his tricks, Daniel's eyes scanned the square. He watched as a number of the jesters slid silently away, melting into shadows and into alleys. This seemed rather suspicious to him, and he continued to elbow his way forward.
"Now," boomed the magician, "my final trick. I shall make my assistant" Isabelle curtsied "DISAPPEAR." A hush fell over the crowd as they waited in anticipation.
Daniel pushed forward in panic and jumped up on the stage.
"NO!" he cried, running forward and tackling Isabelle out of the way, as the magician turned to her. He got back to his feet, sword in hand, and approached the jester.
"Who are you?" he growled, the point of his sword resting against the man's throat. "Are you a simple jester? Or, perhaps, an emissary from Radogan?" With that, Daniel ripped of the man's mask.
11111111111121.title: Who is that masked man?

choices: The magician came over to talk to them
A suspicious old man came over to talk to them
111111111111212.content:
Daniel was surprised to find a pale skinny young face behind the mask. Pale, petrified-looking - and no older than himself.

"Ohhhh, please don't kill me, good sir!" The magician said in a small quivering, panic-stricken voice, "my most gracious, most noble sir, please don't kill me!"

Daniel realised the source of the magician's distress - the glistening sword tip aimed squarely at the jugular - and lowered the sword. Feeling foolish, he attempted an apology. "ummm...sorry, thought you were someone else."

Meanwhile, the audience recovered from the dramatic turn of the events and some started to get irritated. "Boooooo!" "Get off the stage you spoil sport!" "Go pick on someone your size!" The fruits start to be flung onto the stage

Ducking from the flying fruits and heading towards the stairs of the stage, Isabelle has also recovered from the shock of Daniel's theatrics. She quickly lost her famously short-and-fiery temper. "WHAT THE HELL IS WRONG WITH YOU!" she yelled, "DO YOU ALWAYS HAVE TO SPOIL FUN FOR ME!"

Daniel followed her, "SoRRY!" he replied in a small voice, red-faced yet defiant, "I was only trying to look after you"

"LOOK AFTER ME?!" Isabelle yelled, her voice continued to crescendo,"WHAT ARE YOU TRYING TO ACHIEVE BY SCARING THIS POOR LITTLE...Ouch!" She tripped on the last step of the stairs.

"Are you okay?" Daniel asked, concerned.

"I am FINE!" Still ill-humoured, Isabelle attempted to get up and walk, "I don't need your help and...oww oww oww, I think I've sprained my ankle!"

"Hey, here, sit here for a moment and let me have a look." Daniel ignored her obvious displeasure of him and led her to a tree a few paces behind the stage.
111111111111212.title: Oops

1111111111112121.content:
While Daniel expertly worked on Isabelle's left ankle - and Isabelle continued to yell at him at a most unroyal manner - a shadow fell over them.

"Ahem. Do you need help here?"

Daniel and Isabelle both lifted their heads. It was the child-magician that Daniel almost drew blood from. For some reason he now appeared older.

"Er...we are okay here, thanks." Daniel replied, still feeling embarassed about earlier episode.

"Oh. Okay." He turned and started to walk away.

"Hold on, please wait." Isabelle called after him, "Daniel here would like to apologise." She digged him in the ribs.

The child-magician turned back to face them.

"Umm...yes...I am really sorry about before." Daniel managed to squeeze out an apology, then added, "well, you see, my...er...little sister here likes to get into all sorts of trouble, I am always the one having to find her and pick up the mess, and so I was just...Ooouch!"

"Apology accepted. I wish I have a spirited little sister like you. Though I must say you two don't look alike at all." He smiled knowingly. And looked twenty years older than before.

"Er, yes, we get that a lot..."

Isabelle cut in. "My name is Isabelle by the way. I really would have liked to see your trick back there! If it wasn't for my stupid...big brother!" She gave daniel a stare that could kill.

"Well, it's nothing really. Just a little trick to make a bit of money so I can fill my belly with food. From time to time. I can still do a little demonstration if you like." He added, "Not on you this time."

The child-magician (who now looked like a grown-up) picked up an acorn under the tree with his left hand, mumbled something under his breath, made several fancy whirling gestures with his right hand, and - Poof! - the acorn was gone!

"Wow! That was great! How did you do that!" Isabelle exclaimed.

"Sorry, can't tell you." The magician replied with a smile.

"Oh, of course." Isabelle said, mentally kicking herself for being a bit rude. "Can I ask you something though..." she started again, hesitated, then the curiosity got the better of her, "...can I ask how old you are?"

The magician gave a little chuckle. "I am as old as I look." He replied mysteriously, now looking thirty and thirteen all at once.

Isabelle and Daniel were amazed. And speechless with their mouths wide open. A fly flew into Daniel's mouth.

"Just another little trick of mine. Sorry I am just showing off. You can call me Geching by the way."

Isabelle was still speechless with mouths open. Daniel suddenly went into a coughing spasm, resulting in him swallowing the unfortunate fly that tickled his throat.

"Actually I was sent by one of the old ones to keep an eye on you. And to warn you that Radigan is close." He then give an embarassed chuckle. "I guess taking you onto the stage wasn't the best way to hide you from Radigan's eyes, but I just couldn't help myself. I love good theatrics!"
1111111111112121.title: The child-magician

11111112.content:
The woman was old, her skin wrinkled and knarled as tree bark. She looked from the boy to the girl and then she laughed, a long, grating chuckle. When she was finished she smiled an annoyingly amused smile at Isabelle and said "Little princess, I have never met anyone so daring in my life, but I must say, you are the most ignorant person I have ever met also!"
Isabelle's eyes narrowed. She could feel a million nasty things to say bursting into her mouth, and was about to open it and release them all when she saw Daniel glaring at her. She quickly swallowed them again.

"Forgive me, old woman." She said to her "But I do not understand."

The woman's smirk dissapeared suddenly, along with her amused demeanor.

"No." she snapped "No you don't. But you will learn, little princess, you will learn."

She eyed Isabelle a moment longer and then said "Forgive my people, Princess, we thought you were bandits. Follow me and I will I bring you to a place of lodging where you may stay the night."
11111112.title: A Strange Old Woman

choices: The seer senses something coming and the conversation is cut short
111111122.content:
The old woman led them to a large decrepit building which looked as if it would not withstand a light summer breeze, but as their escort explained, it was in fact the oldest building in the village, perhaps even the kingdom.

"This is the home of our seer. She knows and sees all. You can stay here the night until we find some place more fitting, and you may find the answers to some of you questions in the seer. Good night Princess, Daniel," she nodded her head and walked away. Daniel and Isabelle linked arms and proceeded to the front door. Just as Daniel raised his hand to knock on the cold, hard wood door, a raspy, barely audible voice bid then to come in.

"How did she," Isabelle began, "of course, she is a seer."

"Let us hope she can be of some assistance," Daniel replied as he pushed open the door. The two walked down a long candle lit hallway until they reached an open doorway and a well lit room. Upon entering this room Daniel and Isabelle saw a lovely middle aged woman lounging in a chair beside the fire.

"Hello Daniel, Princess Isabelle. I have been waiting for you. Please, sit." She gestured to two chairs in front of her. "We have much to talk about, and not nearly enough time during which to discuss them all." Daniel and Isabelle looked at each other once before taking the seats offered.

"Would you like something to drink - you must be parched." For the first time they noticed the table before them with a pitcher of water, two glass, and two cups of tea with suger and honey.

"Thank you."
111111122.title: The Seer

choices: They disobey the seer and go back anyway
They heed her warning and run in the opposite direction
1111111222.content:
Looking around the room, Daniel found that it did not mirror the outer appearance of the house.

"Pardon me, but I must say the interior of your home in quite the opposite of that of the exterior."

"Well, over the years I have tried to fix it up since it was built for my grandmother. I kept the outside as it is because it reflects that of what people imagine a seer's home to look. I've-" she began but was cut off by Isabelle.

"But, please forgive the interruption, I was under the impression that this house is very old, possibly older than the kingdom. I have been exstensively schooled in the history of the kingdom since I am to one day rule as queen, and I know that it is hundreds, thousands of years old. If the house is as old as it is said to be then it could not have been built in the time of your grandmother. I'm sorry, but it just isn't possible."

"Princess, I thought you had learned not to believe everything your tutors told you. They have lied to you many times before."

"That's true."

"You see Isabelle, seers do not age as quickly as you or Daniel or anyone in this town. I may only look to be of middle age, but in realitly I am over a hundred years old," she began to explain when all of a sudden her eyes glazed over and her head shot back. She gripped the arms of her chair, her knuckles turning white from the pressure. Isabelle and Daniel had jumped to their feet but where unsure of what they should do. After what seemed an eternity her eyes closed and her head slumped forward. They inched closer to her to see if she was alright, and just as Daniel reached his arm out to her, her head rose and terror was written on her face. She rose to her feet and spoke with such force that almost knocked the stunned onlookers to the ground,

"You must leave now. It is not safe," she began pushing them forward towards the front door. "You must hurry, you must get out of this village and as far aways as you can, as fast as you can."

"What's happ-"

"What's wr-"

Their inquiries were silenced as they were ejected from the house.

"They're coming. Radigan knows you're here and he's sent his minions. You must leave immediately." Then to the villagers she called, "Everyone, gather any weapons you have. Anyone willing to fight wait in the square, everyone else inside your homes right now." Ushering Daniel and Isabelle to the edge of the village she warned, "I can protect the village and its inhabitants, but you I cannot. I cannot interfere in a prophecy. Radigan will do whatever it takes to get a hold of you too, especially you Princess. He may not yet know about the treasure for which you seek, he desires you for another reason. Go, go now!" With that she turned around and began to run back to the village square. Daniel and Isabelle stood watching her go for a few moments before acting. Just as they began to run blindly away they heard the voice of the seer once again.

"Beware the blue eyed child with blonde pigtails and freckles. She may look to be an angel, the picture of innocence, but do not be taken in. She is not what she seems, and if you are not careful she will be your downfall and the destruction of all that we know and love...." Her voice faded and Daniel and Isabelle continued to run not knowing where their feet would lead them. They finally reached a small wood no larger than the town square. They ducked behind a few trees and leaning theirs hack on their trunks they slid down and rested on the cold dirt ground. Once they had caught their breath they stood and gazed in the direction from which they had come. They could see the red and orange glow of many torches and the exasperated screams of unknown creatures unable to capture and feed upon their prey.

"We should go back and help them, I can't just run away." Daniel turned around and punched the closest tree in anger.

"Daniel, the seer told us to go. She said she could protect the village. I...you're right, we should be helping them, not hiding." Her voice was filled with concern. Neither knew what to do. Suddenly they heard the voice of the seer, but they knew not from where.

"Don't be foolish children. We will be fine. Do not come near here. You must carry on, you must survive and complete your task. Now go, you are not safe there. Go!"
1111111222.title: Flight from the Village

choices: Radigan forces Isabelle to marry him
11111112222.content:
Chapter 11

Isabelle panted fruiously, she wiped her sweaty forhead and then was feeling tears running down her cheeks, Daniel quickly grabbed hold of her "Oh Daniel,it's my fault that Radigan ruined the village, and killing so many innocent people!" Daniel shaked his head and smiled at her "Don't be silly, dear Isabelle. I swear on my father's grave, that everything is alright-"

"DANIEL!" Isabelle was now screaming almost deafing Daniel's ears He glanced at her then saw the person that scared her most, Radigan.

Radigan came flying above him and grabbed hold of Isabelle, She struggled with all her power that she had left but it was no use, Daniel looked on helpessly as Radigan laughed evily.
11111112222.title: Isabelle Is Taken Hostage

111111122222.content:
Chapter 12

Radigan took a frightened Isabelle to his very dark and cold Castle and looked at her with an evil smirk

"You didn't think i would never get to you did you? With the protection of Lovely Daniel" He chuckled touching her hair.

Isabelle spat on his face "Daniel is lovely,so you better keep your mouth shut."

"Fiery aren't you?" He said smiling "Now, Isabelle, Do you know why i have taken you here?" He questioned

"Nope." She muttered "No?! I taken you here to get you married to me,you are stupid aren't you?!" Radigan yelled at her

Radigan didn't take too much notice to that remark and threw her into a dirty , darky and cold dungeon.
111111122222.title: Isabelle is to marry Radigan

choices: Isabelle manages to escape with Daniel's help
1111111222221.content:
The dungeon was cold and frightening, Isabelle sat on the floor not knowing what to do.

'Isabelle' a soft voice called out. Isabelle turned round to see Daniel calling to her from the barred window.

'Daniel! Where were you?' Isabelle asked frantically as she ran to the window.

'No time to explain. There's a way out of this!'

'How do you...'

'When Radigan captures you, I meet an old lady who helped me get here. She said there's a secret tunnel connecting this cell and the lake right across from here!'
1111111222221.title: A friend returns

111112.content:
"I don't know, what do you think?"Isabelle asked Daniel.

"I don't know."

"Well, lets think, what do poets write about?"

"They write about," Daniel starting thinking. "They write about beauty, love, and...oh, I know. They write about things like the path not travelled, the road not taken, and stuff."

"That's it, so it means to take the path into the forest right, but its so dark and ominous."

"Don't worry, we'll be fine," Daniel reasured her taking her hand and leading her down the path.

After a few seconds Isabelle suddenly poked Daniel in the stomach.

"Ow what was that for?"

Isabelle burst out laughing. Daniel then poked her in the stomach which made her squeak and him snort though his laughter. Isabelle then pushed Daniel. They continued poking and pushing each other until the forest closed up behind them and they reached a clearing inside. Suddenly, a rough voice whispered to them from behind stopping them in their tracks, "Hello, little darlings."

They turned around so fast that they almost fell over. When they turned around, they saw a small old woman. "Who are you," they both stuttered.

"That is not important," she raised her hand to silence there coming interruptions. "I know who you are and there are somethings you need to know. First of all, on this quest you will find several friends who can help on this quest, and many of which can come to the aid of your kingdom and turn the tides of the war. But know this, it is a very dangerous journey you set out upon and many will try to stand in your way. You must be very careful, for the evil sorcorer Radigan will be looking for you and he will take you alive or dead. Be warned young ones."

Daniel and Isabelle just stood there dumbstruck when suddenly there was a sound beyond the clearing. They turned their heads in the direction of the noise, and when they looked back, the old woman was gone. The noise came again, closer this time.

What was it?
111112.title: A Stranger's Warning

1111121.content:
Daniel and Isabelle continued to stare at the bushes where the sounds were coming from unable to move. Isabelle grabbed Daniel's hand, just barely stopping herself from leaping into his arms, when a low growl came from the bushes.

Daniel looked at Isabelle's face and new that she was frozen with fear, and when he saw eyes peering out at them from the bushes he tightened his grip on her and began running pulling her along behind him. He couldn't bring himself to look back, he just kept his eyes infront of him at almost pitch black forest as he tried to navigate around trees and various other plants that seemed to be reaching out for them trying to grab them and feed them to whatever was behind.

Isabelle on the other hand couldn't take her eyes off the creature now in pursuit of them. She wasn't exactly sure what it was but she knew that if it ever caught up to them it would kill them instantly, but she couldn't bring herself to look away and run, so she just kept begin dragged along by Daniel. As she peered at the creature in pure terror she realized that this thing could have caught, killed, and eaten both of them in a matter of seconds, but it hadn't. It was holding back, not running its fastest, instead it was playing with them like a cat would a mouse. The chase was infinately better than the catch. This thought only horrified Isabelle further.

Branches from the trees, protruding roots, and dangling vines grabbed at them both, ripping their clothes and cutting into their flesh. Then suddenly a root seemingly rises from the ground purposefully to trip them. They both stumble over each other and stop when they crash into the trunk of a tree in a small clearing. As the creature casually strides into the clearing looking a little disappointed that the chase is over and yet proud of what it has caught, Daniel pulls out a dagger he had packed and stands between Isabelle, who picks up the largest stick she can find, and the creature.
1111121.title: The Chase

11111211.content:
Daniel stood his ground as the creature drew ever closer, not wanting to put Isabelle in danger and too exhausted to try and escape. The creature just continued to walk towards them, and with a heart piercing roar it leapt into the air and began to descend upon the two. Daniel would not move from that spot. He raised his dagger ready to strike, and Isabelle stayed behind Daniel with a large stick in one hand and a jagged rock in the other. Both were terrified, but both watched as the creature neared them.

It was maybe a foot from them when the creature unexpectedly fell limp to the ground. Both Daniel and Isabelle were stunned. They looked at each other wondering what happened, then looked at the motionless body of the thing that almost had them for supper. Right away they saw an arrow sticking out of it's heart. Once they realized that someone must have saved them by shooting this creature they heard rustling fom the trees. They looked toward the sounds and out came a figure with a bow and arrows slung over its shoulders. Whoever, whatever it was wearing a long dark blue, almost black, cload and hood, and neither Daniel nor Isabelle could see much more of this figure, and neither laid down their weapons.

After a few moments a voice spoke from beneath the hood. "You have nothing to fear from me. You can lower your weapons, I will not harm you."

"W-w-who are you?" Isabelle stuttered from behind Daniel.

"That doesn't matter. Right now we need to get out of here and to someplace safe before any more of those come," the figure said motioning towards the corpse.

"What do you mean it doesn't matter who you are?" Daniel demanded. "What's with people telling us it doesn't matter who they are? First the old woman, and now you."

"I don't have time to explain. We must go now." With that the figure turned around and walked away.

Daniel and Isabelle just looked at each other. Should they trust this hooded stranger or not?
11111211.title: Saved?

111112111.content:
Daniel and Isabelle, in silent agreement, nodded their heads and began walking after the hooded stranger. After a few moments they began to whisper amongst themselves being careful not to let the stranger overhear what they were saying.

"Daniel, are you sure we can trust this person?" Isabelle questioned.

"You know Isabelle," Daniel replied. "I'm not really sure, but this person saved us from that thing and maybe he or she can help us find the treasure."

"Yeah I guess so."

They once again fell silent and continued to walk that way until the stranger disappeared into a cave. Daniel and Isabelle just looked at each again before they followed into the cave. Once inside they were drenched in light from a fire. Their 'rescuer' had a campsite set up and it looked like there was room and enough supplies for them to stay there, atleast for a little while. All three of them sat down beside the fire. The stranger handed them something they could eat.

"Now, you need to rest for the night," came a voice from under the hood.

"Wait just a minute," both Daniel and Isabelle interjected.

"Are you going to tell us who you are or not?" Daniel asked.

"Yeah, I don't want to stay here with someone I don't know," Isabelle confirmed.

"Alright, if you must know," and the stranger lowered its hood to reveal...
111112111.title: At Their Rescuer's Campsite

1111121111.content:
Beneath the hood was an attractive, muscular man who was suprisingly well kept for someone who lives in the woods. When he spoke, he spoke in a deep smooth voice. "My name is Melish, if you wish you may call me Mel. I already know who you are, Princess Isabelle and Daniel, and I know why are here and where you are going. The journey is far too dangerous, it would be best if you turned around and went home. You can rest here for the night, but in the morning you must return home." He raised his hand to silence Isabelle's and Daniel's interruptions. "It would be best for you to return to the castle, but I understand if you feel you must continue down this path. Therefore, I can safetly guide you trough the forest, but no further. From then on you must go alone, hopefully you will find help along the way. For now, we must rest, and you can give me your decision in the morning. We will be safe for tonight, so you need not worry." With that, he got up and found a spot to sleep for the night.

Neither Isabelle nor Daniel got a word in during Mel's entire speech, and they weren't quite sure what they made out of it. So they set up their sleeping bags close together so that they may be able to talk or just comfort each other with their company.
1111121111.title: Melish Speaks

11111211111.content:
After both Daniel and Isabelle had fallen asleep, Melish grabbed his cloak and walked out into the forest. He conitnued walking for a few more minutes until an old woman appeared in front of him, the same old woman whom Daniel and Isabelle had met earlier that day. Melish looked upon her with familiarity. He kneeled before her before he spoke. "M'Lady, I have done what you asked. I found the young princess and her companion and have brought them to the safety of my campsite. But why do you appear now before in that form, why do you not return to your true form?"

The voice that came from this old woman's lips was not the same that she had used to speak the Daniel and Isabelle. Instead, it was silky smooth, melodious, eloquent, and extremely lovely. "I choose to remain in this form as a precaution. If the children come here I do not want them to see my true form, also, I must continue to hide myself from Radigan. For if he ever found me, it would be catastrophic. You have done well Melish. I thank you for your service."

"M'Lady," Melish continued. "It will not be easy to convince them to return to the safety of their castle, and I'm afraid that even if I can get them there, there they will not remain."

"That is good, for they must not return to the castle just yet." Melish was stunned, but remained silent. "Our only hope is for them to reach their goal. For if they do not, Radigan might, and if he does he will be able to conquer our world and many others. These two, though they are but children, must obtain the legendary treasure, for contained within it are things that will help save our world. You must quide them safely out of the forest, but no further, for in the forest you must remain, which you already know. But once they are out of the forest there is another job you must do. King Edward has sent his five best knight after them to bring his daughter home safely, they must not succeed. If they catch up the the Princess and stable boy before they have obtained the treasure, the world as we know it will end. You must stall these knights, but do not completely deter them, for on the return journey, these children will need all the help they can get."

"I will do as you say M'Lady," Melish kneeled once more, and when he arose the old woman was gone. He turned around to return to the campsite.
11111211111.title: A Job

111112111111.content:
Neither Daniel nor Isabelle noticed that Melish had left. Isabelle was sleeping peacefully when she was jerked awake by the sound of Daniel screaming her name, "ISABELLE!! ISABELLE!! NO!"

She quickly jumped up, but when she looked at Daniel she found that he was asleep. He was having a nightmare, and she didn't know whether she should wake him or not. So she sat by his side trying to comfort him.

"NO, LEAVE HER ALONE! ISABELLE!! NO!! GET AWAY! IZIE!!"

Isabelle shot a look at Daniel when she heard him say Izie. He hadn't called her that since they were very young. Why would he scream that?

"IZIE!! NO, NO!! OH GOD NO!"

It looked like Daniel was also crying in his sleep, tears were falling freely from his eyes. He just kept screaming and tossing and turning in his sleep. Just then Melish came running back to the campsite with his bow and arrow ready. Isabelle hadn't even noticed that he was gone. Melish looked around, but when he saw that everything looked normal he lowered his arrow and walked over toward Isabelle and Daniel.

"What's going on?" he inquired.

"It's Daniel, he's having a bad dream," Isabelle answered. "I'm not sure if I should wake him or not.

"Its best to let him rest. Let the dream run its course. Come, lets sit by the fire. We should talk."

Isabelle took one last look at Daniel before following Melish and sitting on a log in front of the fire.

"I've decided," he finally said. "that I won't make the two of you turn back and go to the castle. I will take you out of the forest, but that's as far as I can take you. And you must hurry, your father has sent his best knights after you, but you must'nt let them reach you."

"But how do you know this?"

"Lets just say I have my ways. I don't mean to put any pressure on you, but it is imperative that you and Daniel find the treasure you are after. The fate of the world may be at stake."

"I understand, I suppose," she stared at the fire occasionally looking back at Daniel. Nothing Melish had said really sunk in. She was too worry about Daniel and it showed.

"You really care about him don't you?"

She looked at Melish a little embarrass and her cheeks turned a little red. "Yeah, I do. But no one can know, especially him."

"I don't understand, if you care for him, shouldn't you let him know."

"Oh no, no no no. Think about it. I'm a princess, he's a stable boy, we'd never be allowed to be together, and I just couldn't stand that heartache."

Just then Daniel screamed bloody murder in his sleep again.

"I wonder what he's dreaming about," Melish mused.
111112111111.title: Feelings

choices: that morning Melish shows them out of the forest
1111121111111.content:
~*~*~*~*~*~

Daniel and Isabelle were chained in a dungeon. They weren't exactly sure how they got there, but there they were. Just as Daniel was about to say something an evil looking man came through the door. "I am the all powerful sorcorer Radigan. You, young man, must be the stable boy. What was your name again, David?"

"It's Daniel," he replied angrily.

"And this beauty must be Princess Isabelle," Radigan said lifting her chin so that he might look at her better. "My how you have blossomed, my little princess." She jerked her head to get out of his grasp. He signalled to a man standing at the door. "Bring her, leave the boy. I'll deal with you later," he added looking at Daniel.

As the other man came closer to Isabelle and began unlocking her chains Daniel began to struggle to get free and screamed at him. "Let her go! Get away from her. Fight Isabelle. You have to escape." He kept trying to hit or kicked the man as he dragged Isabelle toward the door. "No! Isabelle! No, no!! Isabelle!!" He tried to break free of his chains, but there was nothing he could do as his best friend was dragged off.

"Izie!" But she was already out the door. A second later Radigan came back in.
"Stop your yelling you foolish boy. There is nothing you can do to save her from what I have planned." The things he said he was going to do was too much for Daniel.

He continued to struggle and scream. Don't you dare touch her! Let her go! You bastard!" Radigan came up to him and brought his fist down upon Daniel's face, cutting his lip. Daniel spit a little blood.

"Now boy, you die." Radigan raised his hands to kill Daniel in a very painful way.

He screamed in pain, "NO!!! YOU BASTARD!! IZIE!! NO, NO, No, no, no...oh Izie..." as his life faded so did his screams.

~*~*~*~*~*~

Daniel shot up and looked around. It wasn't until he saw Isabelle sitting on a log in front of the fire talking to Melish that he realized it was all a deram. He leapt to his feet and bounded over to Isabelle and hugged her, winding and knocking her backwards over the log.
1111121111111.title: Just A Dream

choices: they see a girl being attacked up the road
11111211111111.content:
Once they were able to go back to sleep, Isabelle, Daniel, and Melish got a good few hours sleep. That morning they continued on their way out of the forest without anything very interesting havening. They all talked, joked around, and had fun.

When they reached the end of the forest Daniel and Isabelle stepped out to soak in some sun, but Melish stayed behind in the shadow of the forest.

"Melish, why don't you come out into the sun. you could really use it, you're looking a little pale," Isabelle joked.

"Yes, come along Melish," Daniel agreed.

"I'm afraid," Melish apologized, "that is not possible. You see, I must remain here. I wish you luck on your quest and if your return journey takes you through my forest I will be glad to accompany you. There will be no need to look for me, I will find you. Good luck my friends, and be careful." With that Melish back away and was swallowed up by the trees and the darkness.

"He is very strange."

"Yes he is," Isabelle confirmed. "But I like him. He's erally nice and he did save our lives."

"I didn't say I didn't like. Now where do we go from here?" Daniel asked as he pulled out the book that had guided them into the forest. "Hey, look at this." He pointed out a page to Isabelle who took the book and nearly dropped it when she saw it.

"This can't be...can it?"

"I'm pretty sure it is. Look, it even has his name. Why would Melish be in this book?"

"I don't know, but maybe it explains why," Isabelle answered still in shock and began reading the passage below Melish's picture aloud.

'MELISH IS KNOWN AS THE KEEPER OF THE DRACOON FOREST. A POWERFUL FORCE KEEPS HIM WITHIN THE FOREST. NO ONE KNOWS HAVE HE CAME TO HAVE THIS CURSE PLACED UPON HIM. HE CAN NEVER LEAVE UNTIL IT IS LIFTED. NOT EVEN THE LADY DRACOON (see next page) HAS BEEN ABLE TO LIFT HIS CURSE, BUT SHE HAS PROMISED TO CONTINUE TRYING. UNTIL THEN HE DOES HER BIDDING AND PROTECTS THE CREATURES OF THE FOREST. HE IS ALSO A GUIDE TO THOSE WHO WISH TO PASS THROUGH THE FOREST. MELISH ONLY KILLS WHEN NEED BE AND CAN BE A VERY LOYAL AND VALUABLE FRIEND.'

"So that's why he wouldn't come out into the sun," Daniel replied.

"I suppose so," Isabelle looked back at the forest as her words faded.

"So, who do you think this Lady Dracoon is?" Daniel asked jerking Isabelle back to reality.

"Oh, I dont know."
11111211111111.title: Melish's Curse

choices: Daniel and Isabelle are taken prisoner
They are able to fight and escape
111112111111112.content:
They were about to read about Lady Dracoon when they were interupted by a scream. They quickly put the book away and began running down the path. There was a small hill in front of them, and once they reached the top they saw who had screamed. A young girl was being attcked up ahead. Daniel unsheathed his sword, Isabelle pulled out a small dagger, and the two run to help her.

"What's goin on here," Daniel demanded hoping that this could be solved without anyone getting hurt.

"None of your buisness boy," one of the two attckers snapped while the other put the girl in chains. Isabelle was looking at the girl. She was attractive and the same age as her. The girl just stared back into her eyes, silently pleading for help.

"What are you doing? Let her go," Isabelle odered the men.

"She's just a slave girl, she's no concern of yours," the second one said.

"No, no I'm not. Please help me," the girl screamed before being slapped across face by one of the men.

"Don't do that again," Daniel comanded as he raised his sword, Isabelle aslo raised her dagger. The two men simply laughed. They walked up to Isabelle and Daniel who braced themselves for an attack. Unfortunately, they weren't prepared for to more attackers to grab them from behind forcing them to drop their things. All four attackers just started laughing at them. One put Isabelle in chains, while the other three began attacking Daniel.
111112111111112.title: Attackers

choices: the young girl shows them to her place and helps Daniel
1111121111111122.content:
They were really hurting Daniel, and Isabelle didn't know what else to do. "Stop it! I order you to stop it!" The three beating Daniel stopped long enough to laugh at her.

"And who are you that you think you can order us around?" the fourth asked through his laughter.

Standing up straight and looking right into his eyes Isabelle simply said, "I am Princess Isabelle. Now stop it, and release us at once."

"A princess huh? You know, we could get a very large ransom for a princess," one of the attackers mused as he stopped kicking Daniel and walked over to Isabelle. He took her chin in his hand so that he could look at her face, then he dropped her chin and circled her looking her up and down.

"You know, before we collect the ransom, we could have some fun. She is very attractive, so is the first one we caught. We could kill the boy and have our fun with the girls," said the third turning his back towards Daniel. Isabelle was disgusted at what they were saying and surprised that her plan had backfired so badly, but she hid it well.

"I have no objections to that," said the fourth walking up to her, putting his arm around her waist, and pulling her close to him. Daniel was pretty badly hurt bad he had enough strength to take advantage of the fact that none of the attackerswere watching him. He swung his legs around knocking down the attacker who had his back to him and grabbed his sword. The girl they were trying to rescue had managed to get a hold of Isabelle's fallen dagger and was trying to break her chains. Having failed to break the chains she stood with the dagger in her hands ready to fight.

"Let her go," he comanded as he raised his sword.

However, this was instantly replaced by a resurgence of urgency revealing that it was not yet ready to surrender to shock. “Belongings.” “Pack quick.” “No time.” “Why now?”
