It wasn't untill she got to her bed chamber that everything that had happened got to her. Isabelle was able to hold it all inside throughout the day, but once she was in the quiet seclusion of her bed chamber she let it all go. Isabelle sat on her bed and wept, she wept until she couldn't anymore. Once all her tears had dried up, Isabelle just layed on her bed with red, bloodshot eyes and dried tears staining her cheeks. She was so caught up in her grief she didn't even hear the door open or someone walk in.

"Isabelle?" It was Daniel, the stable boy and her best friend in the world.

She looked up and immediately tried to wipe away the dried tears and hide her face. "Daniel, I didn't hear you come in."

"Were you crying?"

"No, no. It was nothing."

"You don't have to put on a strong front for me Isabelle. Your parents are missing, you have every right to cry."

"No, I am now the leader of this kingdom, atleast until my parents return. I cannot appear to be weak. The kingdom would be in so much danger."

"Well, I won't tell anyone, I promise. Besides, I know how you feel. Your parents were always so kind to me. Especially after the death of my own parents. They practically took me in as their own. I miss them too."

"I know," Isabelle began to get teary eyed once again. "Oh no, I thought my eyes had dried up, I didn't think I could cry anymore."

Daniel sat next to her and draped his arm over her shoulders.

"You've always been there for me Daniel. Always looking out for me. Your like my big brother. If your with me I can get through this."

"I'll always be here, sis. Hey that would make you my little baby sister," he said the last part in a baby voice. Isabelle looked at him and they both started laughing.

The servants have caught on an find it best to leave her alone, they all feel that when she is in that state she is still looking in the castle for her parents, but once she comes out of it she has no memory of it. She is in this trancelike state now. The servants check on her every now and then to make sure she doesn't get hurt, but for the most part she is completely alone.

It had been going unused since the disappearance and was collecting dust. Isabelle glanced around as if looking for something and she found it lying on a table. It was a very old deteriorating, yet still holding together quite well, book. Once she found it, she came out of her trance, usually she'd be in the trance for atleast another hour or two.

1152.content:
Isabelle was in the courtyard. She loved the courtyard - it was beautiful, especially in Autumn, and the earthy colors made her think of adventure and the world outside the 'magnificent' castle she was stuck in. However, right now it was the only blessing. She was to learn Latin for the next two hours!

Mother said it was a necessary component of being a Princess, but then mother said that about everything Isabelle hated. Isabelle was sure it was just to keep her from seeing Daniel again that night. She sighed, fiddling with her quill as she jotted down a few words next to their English equivalents.

After almost an hour, as she dozed in the setting sun, there was a trampling of hooves. Startled, she jumped up and ran to the trees that lined the courtyard. The courtyard was positioned almost parallel to the castle gates, and offered a view of those coming through it. A rider. A black rider, magnificent on the jet horses every messenger used.

Grinning, she abandoned her notes to the wind and raced out to where the guards were questioning him, almost tripping on her skirts.

"Hello, noble messenger!" She shouted in her best 'I am royalty' voice. The effect was dampened somewhat by her flushed face and stumbling.

Nevertheless, the guards saluted and the messenger looked relieved.

"This is the Princess?" He asked the guards. They nodded. "Would you be so kind as to deliver this into the castle, my Lady? This man is tired and rather hoping to avoid an hour of diplomatics." He chuckled and winked at her. She liked him instantly, and reached up for the letter he bore. The royal seal of Radigan was upon it. She couldn't help staring at that seal, knowing all it meant.

The messenger rode past, and Derrick - one of the guards - gently pushed her after him. "Best be off now, Miss. Your parents be waiting."

Isabelle smiled, a little strained, and headed for the castle. She waited until the guards turned away, before ducking into a shadowed piece of land. With trembling fingers, she opened the letter.

12.content:
Isabelle and Daniel had been running around in the several hidden passageways that made up the castle when they wondered into one that lead into the royal meeting room. This room was used mostly for talks of war, taxes, and the like, but today, it seemed it was for talks of myths, legends and treasure seeking. Curious to learn what had the king so intrigued, Isabelle and Daniel hid in the passageway and eavesdropped into the conversation.

"Edward, why are we even having this conversation? It's a myth, an old wives tale, its not real," came the soft voice of the queen.

"But don't you see Jasmine, there's finally proof that it isn't just a myth, that its real and that its everything that it is said to be," the king insisted as the queen let out an exasperated sigh and rolled her eyes.

"Edward, my darling, I know you want to believe this, but this so called proof is probably fake as well. Just some local peasant trying to entertain himself," she continued to try to conince him, but to no avail.

"My love, I know for a fact that it is real, and it's contents can help turn the tides on this war. We will finally have the upperhand over Radigan. Now I know that it is real, and I know it can help us win this war. So can we please stop arguing about it," he concluded refusing to argue anymore.

Just as the queen was opening her mouth to respond the king's advisors entered the room silencing her unspoken arguement. "M'Lord, you wished to see us?"

"Yes, yes, I understand that you have found proof that the legendary Treasure of Malor exists?"

"Yes, M'Lord we have. This is all the information we have on the treasure," an advisor replied handed a packet over to the king.

"This is wonderful," the king thumbed through the packet. "Do you believe that with this information a small group of skilled knights will be able to reach the treasure and bring it back?"

"Of course M'Lord, but only if they are the best, for there are several dangers and tasks that must be overcome to reach it."

"Thank you that will be all," and he dismisssed them with a wave of his hand. They bowed and backed out of the room. "Well, Jasmine what do you think?"

"I don't know what to think. I can't believe that such intellegent men would make a mistake, but I can't believe that the Treasure of Malor exists."

"Well, I do, and in the morning we will send out for our best knights. Once they arrive here we will prepare them to go and bring back the treasure."

And with that the king and queen left the room. Once it was positive that no one was left, Isabelle and Daniel came out of the passageway awestruck.

"Can you believe..." "I know, a treasure..." was all they could say for minutes.

"Oh, wouldn't it be wonderful to go on such an amazing treasure hunt," Isabelle finally replied dreamily.

"Yeah," Daniel came out of his reverie. "That would be great, but only the best knights are going to be able to go. I wish I was a knight, its always been my dream, to become a knight and do knightly stuff like going on this treasure hunt."

Just then Isabelle jumped up as if where she was standing was suddenly on fire. "Why don't we go?"

"Don't be ridiculous. Could you imagine, a stable boy and a princess on a real treasure hunt facing all those dangers? Eveyone would laugh at the thought. And could you imagine what your parents would do if we asked them to go? That would be so funny to see their faces," Daniel laughed.

"Who said they'd have to know?" The seriousness on her face ceased Daniel's laughing.

"You're serious aren't you?"

"Of course I am. We could do it. We're smart, and from watching the knights and training you to be a knight we know how to fight. Not to mention this," she smiled as she picked up the packet with all the information about the treasure. This made Daniel smile as well.

"NO!!" she screamed, lunging futiliy towards him. Andrew and Bernard dragged him away, out of the courtyard, out of the gate...
"NO!" she cried again, sobbing. her fault. all her fault that this was happening to him.
The king looked at his duaghter. yes, she needed disapline. but it was hard for him. a stable boy was one thing. his duaghter was an entirely different matter.
"Just lock her up in her room for an hour or two," he muttered. she fought all the way up the palace steps.
12121111222.title: Daniel's Banishment

12121112.content:
Thomas caught the look on her face and chuckled.
"Don't give me that look! we're not your jailers!"
'What do you mean?" aksed Daniel.
"you don't actually think you're going alone on this quest, do you?" Bernard said, laughing. "you're not going on such an adventure without us!"
Donovan caught Daniel's eye, and the two boys exchanged a smile.
Isabelle only had eyes for Thomas's and Bernard's grinning faces. "you mean... you're NOT taking us back?"

12121112.title: Not Captured!

121211121.content:
Isabelle slepped and dreamed quietly. She dreamed of riding her horse in the open fields, her arms outstretched the wind in her hair.

Suddenly she was awoken by Daniel. Wiping her hair from her face Isa spoke groggily.

"What is it?"

Isabelle looked at the horizon and saw several sahdowy figures on horseback holding torches and gleaming swords.
121211121.title: Night Riders

choices: I want to be a princess
12122.content:
"My dear, you had agreed to this."

"I thought my little girl would have more sense. Now she is wandering the dangerous countryside alone."

"This Daniel is with her."

"That makes it worse!"

He is not going to win by saying their being grandparents within the year is not so bad, so the king tries a different approach. "I know it is dangerous, but she is in danger here too, dreadful danger.
"Radigan has given us a choice, war to the death or he marries Isabella. And of the dozen women he has been intimate with, half are dead, the lucky half.. We can't subject our daughter to that, even if we believed his promises, and he lies constantly.

"!@#$ the Prophecy. It doesn't have to mean my daughter! There must be a hundred versions of it."

Closely looking at the quite worried girl, the Queen confirms "Yes, she can be very helpful. Look at her. She looks a lot like our daughter, and we can disguise her enough to hide the differences. So we parade her around as our daughter and Radigan never finds our child."

The King agrees "Yes, that would be a much more pleasant solution.

12122.title: a call to duty

"I will do my duty, Your Highness."

"Good girl!" the king announces. "Now run fetch the Magician. He will be needed for Our plan to work."

"yes, Your Highness." and Anna, and she speeds off.
But as she speeds along, the idea of fleeing the castle occurs to her. If she stays here, she risks her life, or will spend it in a dungeon. If she flees, she may live a harsh life, but it will likely be a long and free one. She had always been a dutiful lass, but there are limits. Is this one of them?

121221.title: fetch

Anna shook her head and dashed down to the stables. She grabbed a gray horse with white specks splattered around randomly and saddled it herself.
"you want me to get that?" said a young, red-haired boy.
"yes, please," Anna said, fumbleing with the straps.
1212211.title: Flee!!

As has been the case before, Anna realizes that there are drawbacks to doing her duty quickly. Even as she is thinking about the advantages of fleeing the castle, she is knocking on the magician's door.

"Yes?" a woman's voice responds.

"The King has summonsed the Magician. He is to come to the Lesser Chamber immediately." That must be a very brave woman in there. Anna knows she wouldn't dare enter even if her life depended on it. Not that she actually knew of anybody that he had hurt deliberately, but none of the royal guards would come within 50 feet of his door without a direct order, and that seems more than enough reason for Anna or any sensible woman, to stay far away.

"Oh drat, there will be a slight delay." This was a man's voice. It couldn't be the same speaker...could it?

"Come in and give me a little help" Again female, but different. But more important is that the door had vanished, exposing a dark room. Is it too late to run? Probably. In any case, it is probably as dangerous to run as it is to advance.

As she steps in, the room is suddenly lit up, and she sees ..
1212212.title: into the fire

"Magician?" Anna yells to the room, not too loudly since she is not sure she really wants to find him.

A little problem? Anna is sure she does not want to encounter a major one, particularly since the baby is now male.

"Now I want you to fetch that potion from the top shelf. It's a bit out of my reach right now."

Could the magician be a dirty old man?
A sniff reveals he is at least a dirty young baby..
12122121.title: orders

121221212.content:
Males all have lewd minds, no matter what their age. So this little boy needs to be moved to where he can't look up her dress. The baby sulks a bit at this, tho Anna is unsure if that is for the missed view or for the delay in getting the potion.

Just in case, she rushes onto the chair, and then onto the table. Then stretch up to the top shelf and take the...

Does he mean her left or his left?

"Hurry!"
121221212.title: getting the potion

Anna grabbed a red potion and tossed it to him. he drank it down withour a second thought.
then he began to change...

The baby shrank even smaller, then grew fur, a long tail, his ears enlarged...
"no, no, NO!" she screamed.
The rat flailed about on its back for a moment, then flipped over and scurried away into the shadows.
Anna stared at the place it had disappeared in horror.
then a thought even more terrifing struck her:
The King and Queen!!
12122121222.title: Rats! (literally)

What is she to do? The idea of fleeing for her life flashes thru her mind, but however sensible the idea, she dismisses it. No. She must do her duty. Maybe the king knows some way to save this disaster if she rushes and tells him. Maybe...
Maybe she can save the Magician herself!
The other potion must be the right one. So if she can capture the Magician, she can feed him the potion and all will be all right. If it is the right potion, and if she can catch the Magician, and if nothing else goes wrong, and if...

121221212221.title: do something

1212212122211.content:
Quickly Anna climbed back up and grabbed the other potion, taking care not to drop it or slip. Then she is back on the floor and deciding what to do.

Well, she had to find the Magician of course, so time to start looking around the room, under the table, the dressers, cabinets...ah, there's the rat!

She sticks out her hand to grab him, but rats are small, and fast. He dodges and runs under another piece of furniture. Bother. How to get him?

Hmm, Mother did say you caught more flies with honey than with vinegar.... "please Lord Magician...be nice. I have the potion that will make you all better..."
Well, at least he is not running away. "I'll just pour it out for you to drink...Oh dear, I need a dish. I'll be right back." Indeed, a fine dish is in reach as soon as she turns her head. [Odd, she didn't think it had been there before. Well, she has no time to worry that something may be helping her, at least not until she saves the Magician.] Quickly, she grabs it and puts it on the floor in front of her. A moment's fumbling with the stopper and then she is pouring the potion into the dish and then pushing to the rat. "Here, Lord Magician, here's the nice stuff that will make you all better. Drink it, please."
The rat hesitates, so Anna continues "OK, I'll move to the other side of the room where I won't scare you." a promise she quickly keeps.

The rat slowly approaches, sniffs the drink and cautiously looks around. Clearly it is still worried and not thrilled with drinking, but it tries a sip. Finding it not too bad, it tries another. Then it starts drinking hard.

Yes! The potion is working. The rat is turning into....
1212212122211.title: save the magician

12122121222112.content:
Anna's joy continues for a moment longer than it should. Then she sees the shape of the enlarged ex-rat is wrong. She is not yet sure what it is, but it is not the magician.

But what had gone wrong? She had fed the magician the right potion this time, hadn't she? What is wrong?

That is when she sees the 2nd rat...

Oh no. Is this all her fault?

Well, before she can decide that, she will have to worry about what she has caused.
12122121222112.title: Ops

121221212221121.content:
What has she done? What has she released? And what should she do about it?
She remembers tales of grateful prisoners who showered with riches those who let them loose. But she is a practical lass, and there is generally a good reason why people are put in prison, and it's not generosity. Indeed, whatever it is likely no friend of the magician, and thus probably doesn't like her either.

Maybe a weapon would be a good idea. Not that she is much good with them, but how can it hurt? Is there one around here?

Right behind her. This is getting a bit weird. Almost like something is reading her mind and supplying her wishes. Of course, whatever it is could be doing a better job. It's just an ordinary little dagger. Still, it's something, and she clutches it in front of her really hoping she won't have to use it.

Now the form of the former rate is nearly finished changing. Definitely humanoid, but definitely not the magician. in fact it is

It's a demon! With massive black wings, horns, and... a female figure to die for! A fact that is entirely too visible. Anna is torn between jealousy, envy, and scorn. If she had a figure half that good, she could have any male she wanted ... But she shouldn't be wanting them ... And she shouldn't have to be so brazen in showing herself like that ... But ...

Fortunately the demon is paying no attention to the confused lass. Instead she looks around and yells "George! Where are you?"

"George?"

Noticing the girl for the 1st time, the demoness answers "George, my husband. He's the magician at this hick kingdom."

"He's married to a demon?" Anna isn't sure if she is horrified or just enthralled. Nor is she sure if this is a shock or what she expected of the Magician.

"You've heard of attraction of opposites? You better hope it doesn't happen to you, but it hit us hard. We just can't stay apart.
"But haven't you heard of me? It's only been a few years since he turned me into a rat."
1212212122211211.title: enter the wife

12122121222112112.content:
Anna responds "It doesn't matter just now. The Magician has drank a potion and turned into a rat!"

The demoness at least has the grace to look shocked at the news "You're sure about that?"

"I saw it myself. That is why I put out that pan you drank out of."

"Well in that case..."
12122121222112112.title: breaking the news

121221212221121122.content:
"We have to find him and rescue him."

A bit of a surprise, which causes Anna to blurt out "But he turned you into a rat." before she realizes she wants the demon-woman to help her.

Fortunately "He's my husband. If you are ever lucky enough to get one of your own, you will find he does all sorts of annoying things. You have to learn to forgive quite a few of them.
"Besides, it's been years since we have been together, and I don't intend to wait any longer."

The way she says that suggests things to Anna, who decides she really does not want to know how true those suggestion are. So instead..

"But what can we do?"

"Well, for starters..." The woman reaches for one of the potions on a wall. [Was there a wall of potions there before? Anna is trying hard to believe there was. Walls that suddenly change when you are not looking are kinda scary.] But then she recoils. "!@#$. George has them warded against me. He just keeps spoiling my fun."

Anna definitely doesn't want to know what the demoness deems fun. "But now what do we do?"

"You take that potion, that one and that one, and mix them carefully in that bowl I'll go find George."
121221212221121122.title: rescuing the magician

1212212122211211221.content:
Nothing seems to stop Anna from taking the potions indicated, nor from mixing them as instructed. When she is done, she finds that the lady is holding a large male rat. Cuddling it actually. [Anna isn't sure, but she is probably wise in her decision not to look too closely about exactly how the demoness is holding the rat.] "Don't you worry, darling, we'll have you back in no time."

"That's the right rat?"

"Of course. You doubt me?"

"Well, I was wrong, so ..."

"You are not me. Now bring the drink over here."

Anna does, and sets it down as indicated. Then the rat is encouraged to drink, in fact almost forced to. And this rat too begins to change...

A moment later, the rat is an almost generic picture of an elderly mage. Then he is a picture of a very startled mage, due to the demoness leaping all over him. "Darling! You are back! And at last we can..."

Anna in the meantime is trying not to look in the corner of the room where she somehow knows there is now a bed that wasn't there a few minutes ago. There are just so many reasons she does not want to confirm that. Instead she interrupts with "Lord Magician. The King demands your presence!"

"He can wait a few minutes ... or maybe a week!... Can't he?" The look on the demoness' face would have been easily recognized by any well-trained husband as a demand he put her ahead of any mere royal duties.
1212212122211211221.title: the magician is back

12122121222112112212.content:
"My dear. Much as I would prefer to stay..."

"What?!"

"...I really must..."

"You're neglecting me!"

"..see the king first..."

"You worm!!"

"..Now, now..."

But the demoness is not listening. She grabs a potion bottle and throws it at the magician. She misses, but the bottle simply floats back to her, and she throws it again. This time her aim is better, but it comes to a stop an inch from his nose.
As it floats back to the demoness, she grabs other bottles and plates and starts throwing them. These too are somehow blocked from actually hitting the magician, but he is wisely backing to the door. Anna doesn't wait for him to exit, but is out in the passage well ahead of him.

With a "I'll be back as soon as I can." the magician slams the door behind him. There is a crash of something hitting it. "That went better than I expected." is the magician's comment as he leans against the door.

"That went well?" a still shocked Anna asks.

"Oh yes, I was expecting...Oh, that can wait. We had best see the king quickly. I don't want to keep my darling waiting any longer than I have to."

As the 2 hurry down the hallway to where the king waits, the magician mentions "By the way, you showed remarkable talent in there. You might want to consider becoming my apprentice."

And deal with rooms and walls that come and go, demonesses, the chance of getting turned into a rat, and who know what would happen if she were there longer? Anna is pretty sure she doesn't want that.
On the other hand, the Lady Magician wouldn't have to change the sheets or empty the chamberpot...

"I think the king has plans for me."

"Well, when those plans are finished, you should come to see me."
12122121222112112212.title: back to the king

121221212221121122121.content:
"I will do that."

Had she just implied she would become his apprentice? Is she insane? She wouldn't have even had to think yesterday before fleeing such an "opportunity". Now she is at least implying she wants it? Granted, the events of the day have been enough to drive her crazy ..., but ...
But something about the chance appeals to her. She can't put anything close to a name on it, but there is some reason, some probably crazy reason, this is right for her.

Well, it really doesn't matter for now. She is to impersonate the princess, and that will take some time, and everything could change before that is done. There is little sense in worrying now about a future that probably won't happen.

With the comforting thought that she might be dead before long, she guides the Magician into the Lesser Chamber where the Royal couple await.

"So what's the problem, Ed?" The magician's casual attitude towards the king shocks Anna. Even tho she has been ordered that she was to get the Princess in proper attire even if she had to hogtie her first [& it had come close to that a time or two], she wouldn't have considered using anything but her formal title. And he doesn't even bother with the formal name of the king!
Well, if he is able to consort with demons, maybe kings are not that terrible...

"My Daughter has fled, according to plan more or less, and now We desire to use this girl as a decoy. You are to disguise her as the Princess so well that Radigan will have no idea she is a fake."

The Magician considers this "Hmm...

"This will be no problem, Your Majesty. After all, the girl is the Princess' cousin."

"Cousin? How is that possible? She is not of royal blood."

"Oh but she is, and so are a great many of the servants here."

"But how?"

"Your grandfather felt he was Heaven's gift to women, and a good number of women agreed. The result was quite a few children of royal blood."

"But why haven't I heard about this?"

"Your grandmother, and your mother, not surprisingly did not approve and so the matter was kept in the dark."

"But this just completely confuses the Prophecy. Does that mean any of dozens of people could the be the "royal child" spoken of?"

"That might be the case. I never paid much attention to it. Always been half-convinced the whole thing was nonsense."

"Well, Our daughter still needs protection and this girl can provide it. So make her a double for the Princess."

This will give your daughter maximum protection, but there could be problems ending the spell. And I can't guess as to how serious they will be.
"A mere patch will not fool Radigan for long, but it will fool his agents and by the time Radigan is in a position to check himself, it will likely be too late, one way or another. And this will leave you with knowledge of the real situation.
"Either way, you must take risks."
1212212122211211221211.title: advising the king

12122121222112112212112.content:
"You are saying that if you do a complete job, you will fool everyone so well that if Radigan captures the false princess, we will all act as if he had captured the real one. That doesn't seem to be reducing the risks."
"Well, that is not entirely true, but it is a definite risk." the wizard responds.
"Well, we can't risk it." the king decides. "You must do the inferior job so that I and my wife know the truth."
"The false princess will have to know too."
"If she must." the King acknowledges as he turns to Anna. "Very well girl, the next time we see you, you will be playing the princess, and you will be doing something vital to the kingdom. You may have guessed there are risks, but your king expects you to do your duty."
"Take her to the princess's quarters." The king commands the wizard. "One of Our daughter's failings was a tendency to sleep in and so you can do what is necessary and she can rise as my 'daughter', and nobody should be the wiser."
"In an hour, you should be reprimanding your 'daughter' for her laziness again." the magician answers. After a bow that was hardly as deep as Anna feels it should have been, he straightens and holds up his hand. A dazzling set of lights flow from it and flow down around him and Anna, cutting off all view of the room.
When the lights vanish, Anna and the mage are in a different room, the princess's sleeping quarters, where she had found the princess missing, and her note, an amazingly short time ago. "Ah, good. The princess left her sleep clothes." The mage announces. "Put them on, and climb into bed. When you wake, remember you are the princess and just act as you think the princess would act, or perhaps better, as you think she should act."
As Anna darts behind a screen to change, she realizes the mage is right. She may not be able to perfectly imitate the princess, but she could be a better princess than the Princess. Most everybody would deem any errors on her part to be the princess finally growing up and behaving properly. This is not going to be easy, but it may not be difficult.
There is one question she has as she climbs into the princess's, now her, bed. "Could you tell me about the prophecy?"
"Not in full now," the magician partly refused, "Harmon the Mad wrote a hundred very obscure prophecies and if you read them in just the right way, about half of them have been extremely accurate, tho I am not aware of anyone who has correctly figured out in advance what any of them meant. One of those that has not yet come true talks of a princess of this kingdom doing a miracle in its hour of need. Your 'father' is hoping that one is about to come true and is making efforts to see that it does, which requires that you be the 'princess' until the real one succeeds or fails in producing that miracle. Now sleep. When you wake, you will be the princess to nearly all eyes."
Anna suddenly finds it impossible to stay awake and she is sleeping before her head can hit the pillow. The next thing she knows, someone is almost whispering "My lady. It is time for your breakfast..."
A confused idea that she had fallen asleep on duty causes Anna to jerk upright and terrify the maid who was trying to waken her. Anna recognizes her as Terra, a woman quite scared of the princess, and now scared of Anna, which gives Anna feelings of triumph and guilt. If she had not become the princess, poor Terra would not be cowering in fright. But the very fact she is shows that Anna is now the princess to the view of almost anybody.
Today will be most interesting...
12122121222112112212112.title: just a patch, but it should work

choices: The knights are hiding, waiting to attack the two riders
123.content:
The knights had set out early that morning, it was now evening and they were still going and not stopping except to review the packet of information fortelling how to get to their destination. Most of the day was spent travelling on horseback while talking about their plans, among other things. After coming to a fork in the road, some arguing, and double, even triple checking of the info packet they took the path into the dark forest.

Suddenly one of the knights halted his horse and began looking around.

"What is it Donovan?" inquired another knight.

Donovan looked around once more before he started his horse and replied, "I guess it was nothing Andrew, but I could have sworn I heard something."

After about a minute another knight stopped his horse and drew his sword, "What was that?"

"What, what did you see Thomas?" asked the fifth knight drawing his bow and arrow.

"I thought I saw two riders in the woods. I believe I saw them earlier but thought nothing of it then, now it seems they may be following us. But they're gone now, Bernard," Thomas answered.

They continued on without any further discussion of the two mysterious riders. After another half hour they reached a clearing and decided to make camp for the night and set off in the morning.

~*~*~*~*~

Little did the knights know that they were being followed and the two riders were watching them and preparing to set up camp as well.

"This will be a good place for the night. It's well hidden from the knights and we shouldn't be bothered by any wild animals," one of the riders, apparently male, spoke from beneath his hooded cloak.

The second continued to look around uncertain. From beneath the hood came a soft female voice, "Are you sure we'll be safe? And that the knights won't see us? They almost did earlier and if they find us they'll send us home."

"We'll be fine. Are you sure we should tell them we're here and that we want to help them?" the male asked while starting to unpack some sleeping bags and other things needed for the night.

"I'm sure, if they find us they'll send us home. They may even take us home and lose valuable time that could be used to find the treasure," the female responded, helping him set up camp.

"Hey, where's the knights go?"

Both were looking at the knights' camp, but seeing no knights. "I don't know, they left all their stuff there, maybe they went for firewood," the female suggested.

"But they already have a fire, and look there's a large pile of firewood. Maybe we should check it out."

"What if they come back?"

"We'll wait a few minutes. If they're not back in a few minutes we'll investagate, okay?"

"Yeah, I guess that's fine."

A few minutes passed and knights still had not returned to their seemingly abandoned campsite. So the two hooded riders ventured from their own campsite to inspect that of the knights.

"It looks as if they just dropped everything and left."

"Yeah, I wonder why."
123.title: Whose Following Us

"They've been attacked!" Cried Isabelle. she darted toward the sounds of battle.

"Save your breath for fighting," came the grim reply.

a silver blade whizzed through the night and struck the attacking figure in the back, and it screamed in pain. another blade bit into Bernard's attacker, it too dying in screams. one of the taller creatures cried something in a hoarse language, and the rest disappeared into the forest.

finally,Donovan strode quickly to Andrew and knelt beside him.

silence.

"Bernard?"

there was a long paused.

"Do you think we should go back and tell the knights?" Isabelle asked. "I need my knife back."

Isabelle sighed. "We'd better Keep watch in case the knights leave again. we don't want to be left behind."
Daniel nodded. "I'll take first shift."
Isabelle smiled. "Thanks."
~*~*~*~*
Bernard smiled in the darkness. he knew now who it was who had saved them in the battle.
12312.title: The Followers Followed

They wait until they start following them again

"Bernard! where were you?" came a cry. Bernard emerged into the camp. Andrew lay by the fire, Thomas cleaning the split open leg. Jonathon, as usual, was quiet in his own thoughts, his scarred face pale in the firelight. Donovan came up to meet him.
Bernard smiled. "I've found out who it was that saved us from those beasts," he said.
THe group cried out, "Who?" Jonathon smiled. he already knew who. but the others never listened to him. why would they now?
Bernard's smile grew larger and he bent close to the fire, describing the pair.
"Let's go and capture them!" Cried Andrew, struggling to his feet.
"Not you," said Donovan. "And not them. let's wait until they start following us again to catch them."
Jonathan stood dumbly in the corner.
123121.title: Bernard tells them

choices: They are brought to the camp
1231211.content:
Dnaiel jumped at the crack of a twig. "What was that?" he thught. he instinctly reached for his hip, felt the empty sheath, then cursed silently for losing his knife.
He bent low to the ground. if he had to attack with his fists, he will.
"Don't be ridiculous, boy," a voice called. "We have no intentions of hurting you."
"Though if you fight, we might," came another, from behind. Daniel gasped and spun around to the second voice.
"wake up," he hissed at Isabelle. "WAKE UP!"
Isabelle sat bolt upright.
"Well? are you coming?" the voice in the fron said. Daniel spun abck towards him.
Isabelle stood up and pulled her hood over her face.
"Run," she whispered. and they darted to the left--
Right into the hands of Thomas.
"I have them, he called.
1231211.title: Captured

12312112.content:
Jonothan smiled as the two were brought to the camp, their hands tied behind their backs. "They were exactly who he thought they were.
"Great!" Andrew said, smiling. "I was getting worried about you!"
Thomas took a firm gripp on Daniel, whose hood was off when they found him.

12312112.title: Captives in camp

123121122.content:
Isabell sighed and closed her eyes. they found her. they'd rush her back to the palace in shame.

123121122.title: Robin

1231211221.content: Hold on. he recongizes her. but does he keep quiet about it or tell everyone?
1231211221.title: Wait...

1232.content:
The mysterious two riders continued to search the campsite and it appeared that whatever happened, it happened in mere seconds. Just as the two had reached the dying fire they felt cold steel pressed againsted their throats and could sense the two arrowas that were now aimed directly at their hearts.

"Don't move, and you may live through this," instructed the knight called Thomas as he added wood to the fire to shine light upon the situation. "Who are you and why are you following us?"

Neither riders answered. They tried to look to the other with a questioning look in order to try and decide what to do, but the swords pressed to their throats stopped them.

"You refuse to answer then? Well, I guess we will have to restrain you," he signalled to the two knights with the bows and arrows, the two called Bernard and Jonothan. They then gathered some rope and tied the riders' hands and feet.

"Now, lets remove those hoods and see who you are," Thomas continued walking up to the male rider and removed his hood.

"Thomas," Donovan said. "I know this boy, he's only about seventeen. He's the stable boy at the castle, Daniel. Why would he be here?"

"Well, let's see who his partner is," Thomas replied reaching for the second rider's hood, but she squirmed out of the way.

"Izie, their going to find out anyways, there's nothing else we can do," Daniel said.

"Izie?" Jonothan repeated the name in bewilderment.

Thomas finally got hold of the rider's hood and was able to remove it, but when he saw who was under it he nearly fell over in shock. "Princess Isabelle!?!" All the knights were stunned and didn't know what to do, they just stared.

After a few minutes Isabelle finally spoke, "Ahem, but now that you know who we are, do you mind untying us?" She held up her bound wrists.

The knights just stood there, still stunned with shock. Andrew was the first to come out of it, "Oh yeah, I'm so sorry Princess Isabelle, Daniel," and untied them.

Once all the knights had come back to their senses, they fetched Isabelle's and Daniel's supplies, brought them back to camp, and had prepared supper.

While they were all eating their meal Bernard was the one who was finally able to ask of Isabelle and Daniel, "I apologize, but Daniel, your Highness, what are you doing here? Why were you following us?"

The other knights all stopped eating, wanting to hear this explaination.

Daniel and Isabelle put down their plates and just looked at each other trying to decide what to say.

Do they tell them the truth or lie?
1232.title: Caught

12321.content:
"Well, you see, the thing is," Isabelle began.

"We, umm, well..." Daniel tried to continue. Neither knew what to say, so the both began stuttering and tripping over themselves looking for the words.

"You just wanted to come along, look for the treasure, have an adventure. Right?" Thomas finished.

"Well, yeah," they mumbled.

"Oh this is ridiculous," Bernard responded. "Now we have to take them back to the castle."

"Oh no, please no. Let us come along. You never know, we may be of some help," Isabelle pleaded.

"You know she's right," Andrew replied. "But do your parent's know you're here?"

"Oh we took care of it," Daniel reassured him.

"Look, lets just take them back to the castle before anything happens. It's too dangerous for them and their parents are going to be so angry with us," Donovan suggested.

"It is really dangerous," Jonothan said, "but then again having them around could be helpful."

Soon all five knights were talking amongst themselves trying to decide whether or not to take them with them. Finally they came to a decision.
12321.title: To Let Them Come Or Not To Let Them Come

12322.content:
Daniel just looked at Isabelle not knowing what to say, but the princess already had a plan and gave him a reasurring look as if to say 'I got this'.

"Well, you see, the thing is that just before you left the castle on this noble quest my parents, the king and queen, asked Daniel and I to accompany you."

"Now why would they do that Princess, you two are but children," Bernard asked.

"Don't let our ages fool you, we can be very useful on such a journey." The knights just looked at each other silently saying 'yeah, right'. "Don't look at each other like that," Isabelle continued. "It's the truth. Look, when you come to a village, or meet someone along the way, it will be to your advantage if I'm around. After all I am a Princess and will be treated as such, and you, my dear knights, will also be treated as royalty, although less so than myself obviously. Not to mention that my dear Daniel here is training to become a knight, so he can do anything you can do. Not to mention that this could be considered a test to judge whether he has what it takes to be a knight, which I believe he does." Isabelle smiled in Daniel's direction then just looked at the knights to see if they believed her.
12322.title: Lying Through Her Teeth

choices: In the middle of the night
123222.content:
Jonathan just smiled. "My dear little Princess Isabelle," he gently patted her on the shoulder, "I'm sorry to tell you this, but you just aren't that talented a liar. Now do you mind telling us why your really here?"

Isabelle just looked at him a little offended. "Not a talented liar, not a talented liar? I beg to differ. I can convince my parents of virtually anything."

"VIRTUALLY anything. And they're your parents, of course they'd believe you."

"Well, so do you."

"No way, I'm not that gullible," Jonathan laughed. The other knights just glared at him.

"Yeah right. I convinced you I was interested in hearing all about the famous knights in your ancestry didn't I?"

"Wait, you mean you didn't want to hear about them?"

He looked a little hurt so Isabelle quickly recovered, "Oh no, of course I did. It was all so very interesting. I loved hearing about them."

The other knights just laughed at him for falling for that one, especially since they often had to listen to him go on and on about his lineage.

"Well, now that we've had a laugh and finished our supper," Thomas changed the subject. "Perhaps it is time that we rest, we've layed out all the sleeping bags and we will take shifts standing guard, except you Princess and Daniel. In the morning we will take you back to the castle and once again set off."

"But Thomas," both Daniel and Isabelle exclaimed.

"No buts, now go to bed," his voice was so commanding Daniel and Isabelle couldn't help but do what he said.
123222.title: More Lies and Laughing

1232221.content:
Of the seven that went to bed, only six fell asleep; Isabelle was the one that did not. Her mind was swarming with thoughts. She just kept thinking about her life, having to always be so proper, go to balls, have people walk on eggshells aorund her and mock her behind her back, and one day she would be married off to the prince of some neighboring kingdom, have children and force them to live the same life she had lived. This was something Isabelle did not want. She wanted adventure, freedom, and this quest could give her these things, if not it could atleast give her life some sense of accomplishment or make her be grateful for the life she has. However, it seemed that, that would not be possible. Deciding to take a break from her thoughts, Isabelle took a seat a few feet outside of their campsite and stared up at the stars.

"Oh how wonderful it would be to be a star," she thought outloud.

"I imagine the stars feel the same about humans." Isabelle was so entranced by the shimmering lights in the heavens that she didn't even notice when a figure came up beside her, and she slighting jumped at the sound of the knight's voice. "Sorry princess, I did not mean to frighten you." Isabelle looked up at the face of the knight Andrew and saw that his eyes were just as alluring as the twinkling dots in the skies that had captivated her so only moments ago.

"It's quite alright, I just wasn't expecting anyone else to be awake. What were you saying about the stars wishing they could be human?"

"Oh yes, well think about it. Stars don't get to meet new people, fall in love, look at something as beautiful as the stars, or anything else humans can do. Would you really be willing to give up such wonderful things?"

"I suppose you're right, but I need some sort of escape from my life, especially since I probably won't be allowed to go on this quest for treasure." Isabelle stated as Andrew took a seat by her side.

"Is your life so confining that you would jump at such a dangerous escape?"

"Yes," Isabelle simply stated feeling that her answer needed no explanation.

"Well, if it is that important to you, I suppose I can speak with the others. I mean, the treasure would be very useful in the fight against Radigan, and having you and Daniel around could get us quite a few benefits on the way. We'll decide everything in the morning."

"Oh thank you Andrew. You have always been so kind to me. Thank you, thank you, thank you," she repeated as she took him in a tight embrace. They stayed seated for awhile longer once again staring up at the stars, and soon they returned to bed, this time all slept soundly.
1232221.title: Stars

choices: the knights bring Daniel and Isabelle back to the castle
they realize they have no choice but to bring Daniel and Isabelle along
12322211.content:
Hours later something disturbed Isabelle's sleep. She sat bolt upright while a hand swiftly covered her mouth and a voice whispered in her ear,

"Shh, be very quiet, we are not alone here." It was the voice of one of the knights, but Isabelle could not distinguish it between the others due to its low volume.

It did not take long for her eyes to adjust to the dark. There was a hint of sunlight far off on the horizon, but Isabelle did not see anything in their immediate vicinity. The knight removed his hand and helped Isabelle to her feet.

"What-" Isabelle inquire, but was quickly silenced by the knight, now distinguishable as Donovan, brought his finger to his lip as a signal to hush. Looking around she saw that all the other knights were up and looked ready for battle, even Daniel was equipped with a sword and dagger. Donovan handed the princess a dagger, which she took, well educated in the art of sword fighting.

Daniel moved to Isabelle's side, and with Donovan there as well, she felt like a rare china doll they were trying to protect from scratches. It seemed apparent that she would not be able to get two feet of space from them, so she simply remained where she was.

A petrifying screech invaded her ears, and a blinding light forced her to bring her arms to her face in order to shield her eyes. When Isabelle finally lowered her arms, she saw a battle raging on. The knights and Daniel, no longer by her side, were sparring with men dressed in black. She could not see anything of these strange men but the black cloaks they wore. They outnumbered the knights more than two to one, but they were fairing well.

Isabelle was shocked from her observations when Bernard called for her to watch her back. A second later she saw one of these cloaked strangers charging after her with his sword held high. Isabelle prepared herself for his strike and raised her dagger ready to return the strike. She dodged his sword and plunged her dagger into his side. As she was retrieving the dagger, Isabelle sensed someone behind her. She turned around just in time to see another man about to strike her being cut down by Thomas.

Looking around, Isabelle saw that several cloaked men remained, but their numbers were rapidly decreasing. She had no time, however, to revel in the knights impending victory, as an eerie voice, seemingly floating in the air, hissed her name. The young princess spun around, but saw nothing before she toppled over the corpse of a fallen cloaked man. She tilted her head and watched as Daniel killed the last attacker. Isabelle sat up preparing to rise to her feet, but once she was sitting up she witnessed a strange sight. The body over which she had fallen turned to a dark mist and quickly dissapated, as did all the other bodies. Too shocked to stand Isabelle remained where she was until Bernard offered his hand, which she graciously took, and he helped her to her feet.

After the battle, they all were exhausted. Daniel was seated upon a tree stump breathing heavily. Donovan had his hand on Daniel's back breathing just as deeply, though less than Daniel. Jonothan had stuck his sword tip into the ground and was on one knee leaning upon it. Bernard stood beside Isabelle, cleaning and resheathing his sword. Thomas merely stared off into the distance. All were quiet, for a calmness had descended upon them all.
12322211.title: Battle
