ignore the summons and go out and play
124.content:
Just then there was a rattling at the the door, someone was coming in. Isabelle tossed the packet back on the table and she and Daniel were running towards the passageway when a servent entered the room, "M'Lady."

Isabelle and Daniel turned around to address the servant, or rather Isabelle addressed the servant and Daniel stood off to the side. "Yes?"

"Your Highness, their royal majesties the King and Queen, your mother and father, wish to have a word with you. They are waiting for you in the throne room. Daniel, I guess you could wait by the door for her."

"Thank you that will be all," she dismissed the servant. He bowed and walked away.

"I wonder what they want," Daniel said.

"Oh, its probably another ball or something," Isabelle mused. "I hate going to those things."
124.title: Summons

choices: "Do you even have to ask? Of course yes!"
"Eh, no I don't really want to."
1241.content:
When they reached the large elegant doors of the throne room two servants opened them. Daniel waited outside the door as Isabelle walked up to where her parents were sitting. "Isabelle darling, I wasn't sure if you were going to come or not. You have a habbit of disobeying our wishes."

"Yes mother," Isabelle stood before her parents.

"Isabelle," King Edward addressed her. "I have a surprise for you. I know how much you want to get out of the castle for awhile. Well, I have a proposition for you."

"Oh really father, what is it?" Isabelle interrupted.

"Mind your manners Isabelle," Queen Jasmine scolded her daughter.

"Sorry."

"Now as I was saying," the King continued. "Undoubtably you heard what we were talking about in th conference room." She tried to act innocent, but he saw right through it. "Now, now. I know you and Daniel were in one of the passageways eavesdropping. I am going to send my best knights out after the Treasure of Malor and I want you to accompany them, for diplomatic negotiations. They will be treated much better if you are there. Also, Daniel wishes to become a knight, does he not? I suppose, since you two are so inseperable, he may go along as well. It can be considered his knights training. Depending upon how well he does, he may get closer to becoming a knight. What do you think?"

Isabelle responds...
1241.title: A Proposition

12411.content:
"Oh yes! Thank you, thank you, thank you," Isabelle cried as she ran and hugged both her parents.

"You're very welcome my dear," the king gasped as his daughter squeezed him tightly.

"Oh darling, please be very careful. Heed what the knights say and don't go looking for trouble," the queen weeped as she took Isabelle in an even stronger hold. "Ok, go on. Go tell Daniel the news." She wiped the tears from her faced and smiled as she released her daughter.

"You two should gather some clothes and other things you wish to bring, but do not pack too many unnecessary items. The knights will leave at dawn with or without you," King Edward called after Isabelle who was already throwing open the door. "Hopefully when she returns from this little adventure she will finally be able to accept her position and continue on with her royal duties, she is a princess after all," he said to his wife who nodded a still tear stricken face.

Isabelle ran into Daniel with such a force that they both fell to the ground, Isabelle on top. She brought herself to a sitting position on his stomach. He half heartedly struggled to get her off, if he wanted to he could have had her off immediately, but she seemed so happy, he just had to know what was going.

"What are you smiling about?"

"You will never guess." Daniel smiled and raised an eyebrow silently asking her. "Alright I will tell you. Do you remember when we were in that passageway and were eavesdropping on my parents and the advisors?" He nodded shifting a little to find a more comfotable position with Isabelle still on top of him.

"Well, my parents say we get to go with the knights to go find the treasure. ANd if you do a really good job, you'll be that much closer to becoming a knight." Isabelle nearly squealed in delight.

"That's wonderful." Daniel took advantage of the moment to rollover so that he was atop Isabelle. He quickly rose to his feet and offered his hand to her, but instead he received a reprimand.

"Daniel! You made my skirt go up." He hadn't even realized that her skirt had fallen well above her waist, but she was quickly replacing it. "This is why I hate wearing dresses and skirts," she complained as Daniel turned his back to allow her some privacy.

Isbelle smirked, stood up, and leapt onto Daniel's back, nearly knocking him to the floor once more. "Giddy-up little pony. Do you want a sugercube?" She placed her hand filled with imaginary sugar cubes before his mouth, which he graciously pretended to eat.

"A little pony?" he retorted in feigned hurt at the blow to his pride. "Could I not at least be an adult horse? I was hoping to be a stallion."

"Nope, you're my pretty little itty bitty pony," Isabelle goaded.
12411.title: My Little Pony

124111.content:
Daniel obligingly carried Isabelle outside. The sky was a lovely shade of blue with white fluffy clouds, no wind, no chance of rain. Perfect weather for the adventure they would soon embark on. With Isabelle's arms loosely dangling around his neck, Daniel was preparing to release her and let her fall the ground to repay her for turning him into a horse, a baby horse no less. Unfortunatly, he did not do so soon enough, for immediately Isabelle's hands were over his eyes blocking his view. He wandered around well enough for a time, but a root jutting from the ground soon brought him back to a place he has spent most of his time since he met the princess - the ground. Isabelle rolled off him onto her back beside him when Daniel fell face first into the soiled and held her sides in laughter.

"Maybe I should just stay on the ground," Daniel suggested as he turned onto his back and laced his fingers behind his head. "I'll live on the ground, crawl to get anywhere, and make the animals lay down so that I can clean them, though they'll just get dirty laying on the ground so there'd be no point in cleaning them at all. But you're always knocking me down so its futile to even try to stay on my feet for more than a minute."

"Oh you know you don't mind," the young princess replied while straightening out her skirt again before lacing her fingers behing her head and gazing up at the clouds.

"Indeed. You're right." He followed suit and also looked at the balls of fluff in the sky. "Hey that cloud there looks like a lion." Daniel pointed at a cloud, and Isabelle nodded her head.

"That one there looks like a tree." Both took turns pointing to a cloud and calling out what it looked like, though neither saw what, if anything, the other saw in the clouds they pointed out.

"There's a horse."

"Look, a castle."

"That one looks like a rainbow."

"Daniel, that is a rainbow you dolt."

"Oh, right. I knew that."

"Ow, there's something poking me." Isabelle reached under her back and pulled a long stick out from under her.

"Hey those clouds look like two warriors sword fighting."

"I see that too." Isabelle arose from the ground, stick still in hand. "What do you say we sword fight? Or rather, play at sword fighting with sticks."
124111.title: Figures in the Clouds

1241111.content:
"Alright," Daniel accepted her challenge as he sat up and looked around for a long enough stick. Finally finding one appropriate stick, he rose to his feet and standing before Isabelle poised himself to fight. "On guard."

"Let us begin." Isabelle made the first move, striking at Daniel a few times, only to have him block her attempts. In turn he lunged at her, she dodged the blade before once again attacking Daniel.

~*~*~*~*~
Meanwhile, a short distance from where the two were play fighting, just outside the stables, five knights were packing several saddle bags and talking amongst themselves.

"This is foolishness!" one shouted, obviously irritated. "We are on a mission to locate and retrieve a treasure which may prove to aid our kingdom in the coming war. How can we be expected to baby sit two infants?"

"Thomas calm yourself," another responded. "First of all, they are not that young, and Daniel is training to become a knight, he won't be in our way. And just think of the advantages we'll have passing through villages with the princess by our side. Second, King Edward himself asked us to allow them to come with us. It would be treason not to do so."

"Andrew is right Thomas."

"Thank you Jonothan," Andrew interupted.

"No need to gloat Andrew," Jonothan continued. "Beside, its amusing watching those two. They are very odd and do random things. It is also interesting watching those two continually flirting, but it seems they do not see their feelings for each other."

"Irritating is more like it."

"What do you mean by that Donovan?" Andrew inquired.

"Those two are always all over each other. I wish they would just kiss or something and be done with it," Donovan replied. "Am I right Bernard or am I right?"

"I don't think you're right at all," Bernard answered looking over at Daniel and Isabelle sword fighting with sticks. He smiled to himself and went back to packing a few more saddle bags. "True, those two do everything together, but they are merely friends. They may even see each other as brother and sister, but nothing more."

"That's what you think, but I still say those two have a lot of sexual tension to work through."
~*~*~*~*~

Daniel swung his stick and disarmed Isabelle of hers. She quickly turned around to reach for her fallen stick, but Daniel had already positioned his stick before her neck.

"Looks like I win. Do you want to try again?" Daniel gloated. His satisfaction was short lived and ended with Isabelle's elbow in his gut. "OW!" He dropped the stick and clutched at his bruised stomach. "That was unfair, and completely unwarranted."

"That's what you get for gloating." Isabelle giggled and picked up Daniel's dropped stick pointing it at Daniel's throat. "And who did you say won?"
1241111.title: Play Fighting

choices: he tells them to go get ready
he helps them with their sword fighting
12411111.content:
With the stick in her hand still aimed at Daniel's throat, Isabelle knelt down and retrieved the stick she had previously dropped. She lowered her sword and tossed the second to Daniel. Though caught off guard, Daniel was able to swiftly raise his hand and catch it.

"How about a rematch Daniel, or would you prefer to quit while I'm ahead?" Isabelle smirked. A moment later Daniel brought his stick down upon Isabelle who just barely blocked the blow. Neither said another word as they recommenced the process of attacks and blocks.

~*~*~*~*~
By the stables the knights had already finished packing several bags and were letting the horses eat and rest. They were now with their families spending as much time with them as they could before they left and saying their goodbyes, all except for Bernard. Bernard had already said goodbyes to the few people he needed to and was using his remaining time to rest, plan, and clear his head.

At the moment, Bernard was once again watching Daniel and Isabelle play fighting. True they were very close, but he was almost positive that they saw each other as nothing more than brother and sister, if that. Bernard was the youngest of the five knights at twenty years old. His father and grandfather, and possibly farther back than that had all been knights, so he had been trainging since he could walk. It was always known that he would become a knight, even the king and queen knew it, they just had to wait until he was old enough.

Now watching the two playing, Bernard thought back. As a child he and Daniel had become close, Daniel always helped him train and was practically a brother to him. He did not know Isabelle well, but she was a sweet girl.

Already packed and having said his goodbyes, Bernard made his way toward Daniel and Isabelle, they would need to pack some things soon.
~*~*~*~*~

"Daniel, if you can't even beat me how do you expect to become a knight?" Isabelle jokingly asked.

"Don't sell yourself short, you've been training about as long as I have. Besides, how can you be so sure I'm not going easy on you?" Daniel contested.

"Because I know how well you fight, and she's the one going easy on you." Daniel and Isabelle turned to see Bernard leaning against a tree trunk a few feet away.

"How true," Isabelle smirked. Daniel saw and used his free hand to push Isabelle.

"How are you today Bernard?" Daniel asked. "Are you ready for our little treasure hunt tomorrow?"

"Yes I am, what about you two?"

"Well, no."

"Just as I thought."
12411111.title: Ready

13.content:
"Daniel, you should really let me talk to my parents about this, I'm sure there's something they could do to help," Isabelle suggested as she cleaned the mulpitle cuts on his back.

"Isabelle I told you, I don't want anyone to know. Besides, if I'm there to be an outlet for his rage he won't take it out on my mother or my sisters. Once I'm a knight I can take care of things." He winced as pain shot through his back.

"Sorry."

"Ahem." Neither Daniel nor Isabelle had noticed the servant now in the stable with them.

"Yes Emma?" Isabelle asked while Daniel recovered his injuries with hir shirt.

"Your Highness, the King and Queen wish to see you in the royal conference room." Emma bowed when she had finished.

"Thank you." Emma left the two alone once again.

"You should go," Daniel said.

"What about you, we haven't bandaged all your injuries."

"I'll be fine. You don't want to upset your parents," Daniel told her as he packed up his things. Hesitantly Isabelle left Daniel to meet her parents.

As Isabelle entered the royal conference room the conversation immediately hushed and everyone rose to their feet, her father, the King, at the head of the table with his advisors filling most of the other places at the table, and her mother, the Queen, in a chair against the wall.

"Father, Emma said you wished to see me"

"Yes, yes my dear. Come have a seat by me." The advisors moved around so that she could sit beside her father. Before sitting down, Isabelle glanced at her mother, who smiled, but Isabelle could see that she wasn't really happy. Whatever her father wanted to talk to her about must be important and something she wouldn't like, otherwise he wouldn't have his advisors there to try and convince her it was for the best.

"We have a very important issue to discuss." Everyone in the room remained still. "Isabelle, you are sixteen years old, and we have been putting it off for awhile now, but its time for you to be married. We have just finished negotiations with the King of Callorn. His eldest son is nineteen years of age and looking for a bride. Contracts have been signed, and you and Prince Hector are now betrothed."

"WHAT?!" Isabelle screamed and stood up so fast her chair fell with a loud thud silencing the room.

"Isabelle, mind your manners," the King told her.

"Sorry father, but why?"

"Well, the thing is your Highness," one of the advisors chimed in, but quickly quieted at the glare he got from Isabelle.

"The thing is that you are of age and must be wed," another braver advisor continued. "Your father won't be around forever and before his time is up you need to be wed and working on an heir. The kingdom needs a king. No offense your Majesties."

"Not to mention," another added, "that Radigan is still after the kingdom and we can't have any weaknesses any vulnerabilites."

"I-I need some time to think. I just need to be alone right now," Isabelle replied as she walked out of the room and into her bedchamber.
13.title: Betrothed

choices: Prince Hector takes the news well
131.content:
Not one had moved an inch since Isabelle's little outburst. With a heavy sigh the queen rose to her feet and waved her hand, dismissing the advisors. Once they had closed the door behind them leaving the king and queen alone, the queen took the seat beside her husband.

"Oh Jasmine. Say something, please. This silence of yours could have the holy monks pleading with you to speak."

"Edward dear. I just can't help feeling that what we're doing isn't the right thing. It is not fair to Isabelle, and as you can plainly see she won't accept it. She has a strong spirit, and she's as stubborn as a mule. You're going to have to do your share of pleading to convince her to go through with this wedding."

"True, she is rather incorrigible. But it would be nearly impossible to back out of the marriage contracts with the King of Callorn without starting a war between our already uneasy kingdoms."

"Nearly, but not quite impossible darling."

"I suppose you are right. Hopefully he will understand. At the least he may allow us to postpone the ceramony a fe years, long enough for Isabelle and Hector to learn more of each other and maybe even form a relationship on their own."

Before another word was said the door opened and a timid little servant walked in, refusing to lift his eyes off the floor to look at their majesties.

"Begging your pardon for the intrusion your royal majesties. But a Prince Hector of Callorn is here seeking an audience with you." The king and queen lock eyes for a moment before signaling to the servant to let him in. Queen Jasmine resumes the chair she occupied when they broke the news to Isabelle while King Edward rises to greet their guest.

Prince Hector walked in, in his richly tailored garments looking kind and generous, but there was something about his eyes that just didn't look right. They never seemed to stay one color - though most just played it off as a trick of the light.

"I apologize for my unannounced visit, but there are a few things still to be arranged your majesties."

"That is quite alright. And there is no need to be so formal, we are soon to be family." Kind Edward gestured for Hector to sit down, and once he had done so Edward also took his seat.

"Yes, of course. That is why I am here. You see, a wedding is a lot of work and we really should get started on the arrangments."

"Well, the thing is Hector, we've told Isabelle and she is not at all pleased. So we have been talking it over, and we feel it may be better if we cancel, or at least postpone, the wedding. It is going to take some time to get Isabelle used to the idea of marriage."
131.title: Postpone the Wedding?

choices: see how Isabelle takes the news
1311.content:
"I understand perfectly. Isabelle is young yet and the idea of settling down, especially with a complete stranger, mustn't be in the least appealing to her. I'm sure we can work something out"

"We are pleased to hear you say that Prince Hector. How about we take a little break and have some tea?" Queen Jasmine offered. She made her way to the door and asked one of the servants waiting outside to fetch them some tea.

"Yes, we are pleased. No king wants to renegotiate a contract and we were not sure how your father would react to our altering our deal. The last thing we want is a war." A few moments later the servant returned with a tray carrying three cups of hot tea and set it on the table.

"Don't get up your majesties. I'll get those for you." Hector dismissed the servant and reached for the cups. Now, no one in the room saw (and were you there you wouldn't have seen it either) but that prince put something in those drinks and he may have even said something under his breath, but it was even less noticable than what he did to those cups of tea. He only did something to two cups, and those he gave to the king and queen.

"Here you go your majesties."

"Hector, I've told you there is no need to be so formal with us."

"Yes, I apologize." He brought the cup to his mouth, but he did not drink. Instead he watched the king and queen, waiting until they have drinken the last drops of their teas, which they did shortly.

"Now, about that wedding," Hector said as he set down his cup not one sip short of his tea. "I'm not so sure I want to postpone it."

"Yes the wedding." King Edward was looking into his empty cup as if he could read the leaves a decipher his future. It didn't look like either he or Queen Jasmine were all there. They had blank expressions on their faces and their minds appeared to be in another world.

"Like we said Hector, Isabelle isn't ready to be married," Jasmine replied. "But we can try to talk to her."

"Actually, I was thinking. If she doesn't learn some obedience no other prince will take her, and things won't be easy for her."

"Yes, you're right."

"I am willing to marry her, but it has to be right away. The sooner we are wed, the sooner she will learn to love me. It is all for the better that we be wed immediately."

"Of course. The sooner the better." Their vocies were emotionless, but Hector wasn't put off by this. He looked pleased and he kept pushing the subject.

"I can organize all the necessary preparations, and we could be wed, why tomorrow evening. All you have to do is have Isabelle there on time, and convince her to say 'I do' when the time comes. Do we have an agreement?"

The king and queen nodded their heads, still looking off into the nothingless and meekly replied, "Yes."

"Wonderful. I am off to prepare, I trust that you will inform Isabelle of the good news." He didn't wait for an answer before exiting the room.
1311.title: The Wedding's Tomorrow?!

13111.content:
The king and queen walked into Isabelle's chanbers to find her seated by the window gazing out, her cheeks still glistening with freshly shed tears. This would have softened any parent's heart, but unfortunately these two were still under the influence of their modified cups of tea.

"Isabelle, we need to speak," her father said in his empty monotone. Isabelle showed no sign of having heard what he said, or even of knowing they were standing a few feet away.

"We have wonderful news for you." Her mother's voice echoed that of her father's. At hearing this Isabelle swirled around in her chair to face them.

"You mean I don't have to get married?!" She was leaping from her seat ready to jump into the arms of the king and queen and embrace them in a loving hug, but her heart shattered when they voiced their reply.

"Actually, we have moved up the wedding date. It will take place tomorrow afternoon." Isabelle returned to her sitting position and again stared out the window.

"Get out," she whispered. Whether is was whatever compassion they had for her, or lack there of, Kind Edward and Queen Jasmine obeyed their daughter's command. Tears once again stained the fair skin of the young princess. Supper was brought to her by one of the servants, and when he returned to retrieve her plate he found that not only had she not touched the food, but she had not moved from her place before the window.

With the lights extinguished and only minute amounts of starlight filtering through the windows no one saw or heard when young Isabelle slipped into her bed for a peaceful night. She woke up rested and refreshed without a care n the world, that is until she realized that the events of the previous night had not been some terrible nightmare as she had hoped. Luckily she did not have long to dwell on this fact, for a moment later she found that her parents were seated by the window she had been so attached to the night before. Still clutching to her covers, Isabelle brought herself to an upright position and stared intently at her parents refusing to say the first word.

"Dear Isabelle. We were cruel last night. We didn't try to explain anything or to comfort you, and for that we sincerely apologize." The king's voice held much sorrow and guilt, and it was obvious how much he cared for the daughter he had so severely wronged. Her mother on the other could not bring herself to say a word, and she looked to be on the verge of tears.

"Does that mean you will reconsider, put an end to this marriage nonsense, and let me live my life?" Isabelle's voice was not cold, instead it mirrored that of her parents' the previous night. At this point Queen Jasmine's silent tears began to fall. With his arm around his wife, Kind Edward replied:

"I'm afraid that just isn't possible. Prince Hector already has the entire wedding planned out, everything is arranged. And from the impression I got from him last night, neither he nor his father will be pleased to hear that we wish to cancel at the last moment. If we do not go through with this, I fear that the kingdom of Callorn will declare war on us. Even if we win the war, the damage will be immeasureable, much of it will be unrepairable, not to mention the lives that will be lost. The kingdom will stand by our decision if it comes to that, but their is a small rebel force building, and a war could increase their numbers and power, and we will be forced to fight a war among ourselves. I can't let that happen, and as the crowned princess, neither should you."

They sat there for what seemed hours; Isabelle thinking the matter over, the king awaiting her decision ready to declare war if she wanted, and the queen silently weeping to herself afraid of losing her daughter either to this Prince Hector or both to war(whether if be abroad or in their backyard).

"What do you say Isabelle?"
13111.title: Marriage or War

choices: Daniel and Isabelle talk through the night with no sign of Hector
131111.content:
It was such a lovely night, a clear sky filled with an unnatural amount of stars, the kind of night every girl wishes for for her first night as a married woman. Not to mention that one of the stars had been plucked from the dark blanket covering the air and made into the ring now resting on her finger. Isabelle sat before the fire in her new bedroom. It had been beautifully furnished and the canopy king sized bed looked very inviting, but Isabelle wasn't ready for sleep. Instead she was reminiscing on the events of the afternoon.

Prince Hector had been very effecient. He had every little detail planed for the wedding, given how short a time he had to do so it was quite the accomplishment, he'd even picked out Isabelle's wedding gown. She had to admit that she couldn't have found a more perfect dress if she could have pulled one out of her dreams.

All she had to do was to have her gown fitted. Then she merely had to wait for the big moment. She had spent her time either with her parents or with Daniel. Isabelle and her parents did not always have much time to spend together, but this time was tainted with the knowledge that soon Isabelle would be handed over to a stranger against all of their wishes.

The time with Daniel was refreshing, Isabelle could complain, reasure herself and Daniel that what she was doing was the right thing, and once she was finished they could go have some fun.

The wedding had come and gone, more like a dream than anything else, a strange misty auror surrounding everything - except for the groom which at the time Isabelle had found incredibly odd - a cool breeze and the soft sound of music floating on the air.

They'd said there I do's, but Isabelle dreaded when the priest would finally say, "You may kiss the bride." Luckily when the time came, it didn't turn into the nightmare she had expected. Prince Hector, her...husband, placed his hand beneath her chin and when he lifted her head and looked into her eyes, he kissed her so gently, just barely brushing his lips against her, and it only lasted a couple of seconds. It suprised Isabelle, but she was glad that this man, this stranger, her husband, had not tried to force it.

He escorted her to the reception, a pleasantly enjoyable celebration, and she genuinely had a nice time. Prince Hector then escorted her to the room they would share from then on as a married couple. He had told her that he would say their goodbyes to the guests, that he had some things to talk over with her, rather their parents, and that he would be back later, that she could go through some of the gifts they had received.

Isabelle had resigned herself to her seat before the fire thinking, This is all so sureal. I am only sixteen years of age, I've never had any romantic feelings for anyone, or even any dreams where I was romantically involved with anyone. Now I'm married to a complete stranger, however, he does seem like a really sweet and chivalrous man. Maybe one day I can get used to the idea of being married to him, perhaps even grow fond of him. But whatever will I do when he comes back. What if like every man out there he wants to, umm, consummate our marriage?

Her thoughts were interrupted by the squeaking of Daniel emerging from the hidden passaeway concealed by one of the many tapestries in the room. He had his arm in front of his face shielding his eyes.

"Is it safe for me to look, or are you and the husband, ahem, busy?" he joked.

"Yes Daniel, its safe. Prin - I mean Hector isn't here at the moment. And even if he was, how could you think I would do that the first day I meet the guy?"

"Well, you did marry him the moment you met him."

"You know I had no choice. So then what are you doing here, for all you know we may have been in the middle of something?"

"Isabelle, I've known you practically our whole lives, I like to think I know you better than that. Besies, I saw your Prince Hector speaking with your parents a little while ago."
131111.title: Wedding Day

1311111.content:
Daniel wandered over the the piles of presents in the corner of the room and lightly fingered the ribbons and wrapping paper.

"So, have you opened any of these yet?" Daniel inquire picking one up and gently shaking it.

"No. I've, had a lot on my mind. You know, being married and all, I'm going to be experiencing so many new things. The presents never crossed my mind." She saw him shaking yet another present and smiled. "If you're that eager to know what's in them, you can go ahead and open some."

"Really? I think I will. Hmm...this one looks promising." Tearing the gift wrap to pieces, Daniel unwrapped one of the presents to reveal a slender box. Daniel removed the lid and smirk.

"And promising it is. Lookie here Isabelle. I think this is more of a present for the Prince than for you. This one looks nice though." He pulled an elegant satin night gown from the box and held it up for Isabelle to see.

"This one of the other hand, well, its more appropriate for a wedding night." The smirk on his face grew to unusual proportions as he pulled out some rather revealing lingerie and placed the box on a table.

"Oh my! Why would someone give me something like that?"

"Well Isabelle, you are married now. It only makes sense that you will wear something like this at least once. Why don't you try it on, see how it looks?"

"Daniel!"

"What?" He put on his most innocent face and his biggest puppy dog eyes.

"I am not going to put that on, for you or anyone, even if I wasn't, and especially because I am, married." Daniel looked so disappointed at first, but only for a moment.

"Oh well. I wonder what's in these other presents. You'll be sure to tell me right? Good, because it's getting late and I should go check on the animals before I go home. Besides, I wouldn't want your husband to walk in to find another man with his wife." And he bagen making his way to the secret passageway.

"Good night Daniel." Isabelle stood and gave Daniel a light kiss on the cheek.

"Good night your highness." Daniel bowed, smiled, and disappeared behind the tapestry into the passageway. Isabelle giggled at his formality and his bow, then sauntered over to the presents. She picked up the satin night gown and couldn't hlep but smile.

"He was right, it is exceedingly lovely. Well, I guess there's no harm in just trying it on." She undressed and slipped on the night gown. "This satin is so soft and smooth, and this night gown is so comfortable. I must remember to thank whoever gave this to me."

"I should thank them as well," a deep voice came from behind her. Isabelle reached for blanket to cover herself as she spun around to come face to face with her husband.

"We're married now, there's no need to cover up such a beautiful form." He softly pulled the blanket from her fingers and allowed it to fall into a heap on the floor by their feet. Taking Isabelle's hands, Hector lead her to the bed and sat her down. He sat down beside her and, taking her face in his hands, he kissed her. To her suprise Isabelle found that she had no aversion to his kiss and was on the verge of returning it.

However, the surprise of Hector laying her down upon the bed and moving one of his hands down to her hips kept Isabelle from either kissing him back or stopping it. Before she knew it she was on her back with Hector ontop of her with and arm and leg on either side of her kissing her neck.

"Hector, Hector please. I, I don't know if I'm ready." He continued kissing her neck for another minute before looking up and into her eyes.

"Oh, come on Isabelle dear, you know you want this, you've been yearning for this, desiring it every since you laid eyes on me, ever since you found out that we were to be married." Looking into his eyes Isabelle saw something other than the unnerving color changing, lust. And yet, it was not simply lust she saw. This was something more, a deeper want and desire and - for lack of a better word - pure evil. "And please, call me by my true name, Radigan."

"Radigan?! Oh my god! Get off, get off me right now! Oh please," she begged.

"Now now, that is no way to speak to your husband." The sudden realization that she was not married to a prince from some kingdom who she hadn't met until today but to the evil Radigan sruck her like a boulder. And she began to weep with the knowledge that no one would believe him to be Radigan, that she was stuck with him until the day she died, and that she was his wife and as made apparent tonight he would take every marital benefit any time he wanted.
1311111.title: Wedding Night

choices: Radigan has awoken and sent the guards after them
they go to tell Isabelle's parents that Hector is Radigan
13111111.content:
Radigan continued kissing Isabelle as she merely wept, but a moment later she heard glass shattering, saw broken pieces of a vase raining down on her and Radigan, and felt his unconcious body slump down upon her. His body was then rolled off her onto the floor and Isabelle saw the worried face of Daniel looking down upon her.

"Are you alright Isabelle?" he asked with concern as he offered his hand to help her to her feet.

"Daniel, thank you thank you thank you so much. He's, he's Radigan, he was going to, to..." she took his hand and once she was on her feet she fell into his arms still crying.

"Shh, it's alright. I'm here. He can't hurt you, I won't let him." Once her sobbs subsided Isabelle was able to stand on her own, and she asked how Daniel just happened to be there to save her.

"Well, when I got downstairs I saw your parents and Hect- Radigan having some tea, and you see the way his eyes never stayed the same color for more than a few seconds always made me a little uneasy. And then I saw him down there, and your parents had these strange expressions on their faces. They were completely blank and emotionless. He told them to go to bed and all they did was nod and wander off without a word, and nothing seemed right about it. I knew he was coming here, so I just had to check on you. I am so glad I did though."

"Me too Daniel. I owe you everything. I-" she was cut short by a moan coming from the still motionless body of Radigan.

"Perhaps we had better get out of here before he comes to." Isabelle nodded, and Daniel led her to the hidden passageway, knowing that Radigan knew very little about the orientation about the castle and nothing about the passageways, which Daniel and Isabelle used to play in constantly and many of which even most of the staff did not know about.

Neither said a word as they made there way through narrow passages and down darkened staircases, with one stumbling on occasion only to be caught by the other. Finally they emerged into the cool air of the dark night. They make their way to one of the large oaks on the grounds and come to rest beneath it. Isabelle gazes up at the stars and the beautiful full moon and wonders how something like this could happen. Daniel notices that she is wearing the night gown that he had unwrapped and how enchanting it looks on her in the moonlight.

"I see you're wearing that sating night gown."

"Hmm?" Isabelle looks down and nearly screams when she realizes that in the rush to get away from Radigan she had forgotten to grab something to cover herself with. She pulls in her knees, wraps her arms around herself, and turns away humiliated.

"You don't have to be embarrassed Isabelle. We've known each other since we were toddlers, I've seen you in less clothing, even if we were only five. And no one can blame you, after what just happened." She turned her head to once again face him and they both smiled.

"Now, I know you keep some extra clothes in the stable for whenever we go riding and what not. So, what do you say we go get those?"
13111111.title: Escape

choices: they make it safely into the forest
131111111.content:
Daniel waited outside the stable while Isabelle changed and disguised herself. Just then he saw lights flickering in several windows of the castle, as if candles and torches were being lit throughout the building. Isabelle walked out of the stable dressed in boy's clothes with dirt on her face, neck, hands, any skin that showed.

"You should sully your face and retrieve any food or supplies you may have scattered in the stables." Daniel nodded and proceeded inside. It surprised Isabelle to see so much light coming from the castle, and it shocked her to see servants and knights rushing out of every exit most barely dressed. They began running around the gournds as if looking for something, the knights rushing to gather their supplies while still looking for whatever was evading all of them. Isabelle was sure they were looking for her, but she truly hoped she was wrong, so when one of the servants (she did not recognize him, he must have been new) came up to her.

"What's going on," Isabelle deepened her voice and tried to change it as much as she could while still making it sound realisitic.

"I'm not completely sure. But what I hear is that the stable boy, Daniel, has kidnapped the princess. Prince Hector is outraged and has everyone searching for them."

"Daniel, why would he kidnap the princess?"

The servant thought for a moment trying to think of some reasonable explanation. Isabelle stood hoping that he would leave soon so that she and Daniel could escape. "Perhaps he is working for Radigan. Everyone knows that if Radigan was to capture the princess he would be able to seize this kingdom without any trouble. When Daniel is caught, he will most likely be inprisoned, questioned, and shortly thereafter executed. You would do well to join in the search." And he ran off after all the others, probably thinking that they would somehow be rewarded if they found the princess.

"Daniel," Isabelle whispered walking through the doorway of the stable. "Daniel?"

"What is it Isabelle?"

"We must leave immediately, the entire castle is searching for us under the belief that you have kidnapped me."

"Horses would draw too much attention. We have to go on foot. We can make our way to the back of the stables and if we can escape detection we can disappear into the forest."
131111111.title: Disguised

choices: Radigan concocts a spell causing Isabelle to fall in love...with Hector
Radigan's spell causes the disapearance (not death) of Daniel...
1312.content:
Prince Hector is silent for a few seconds. The majesties sense something brewing under his charming demeanor.
"Just where does that leave me, your majesties?" Prince Hector asks, clearly quite peeved.
Edward and Jasmine are at a loss for words, finally King Edward speaks.
"Hector, I understand why this would upset you-"
"Do you? Do you really?" Hector interrupts. "I wish to be married to Isabelle as soon as possible. I think the two of you understand the urgency...or DO YOU NOT?" Prince Hector replies, his throaty voice raised. "Your majesties, we had a deal. I've upheld my end of our pact, have I not?"
"Yes Hector, but we won't speak of that right now." Queen Jasmine says.
"On the contrary my lady, LET'S SPEAK OF IT RIGHT NOW!"
"Hector that's quite enough!" King Edward yells sternly.
"No, no, no. This isn't enough! But do you know what was?" Hector yells at the both of them.
They say nothing.
"The hefty monetary donation I gave to your palace for your daughter's hand! You've recieved my donation...but am I married?"
"Hector--"
"Either have my complete donation back to me tonight or have my future wife to me tonight. Those are your options...NO MORE NEGOTIATIONS."
Hector leaves the room, and Edward and Jasmine talk amongst themselves.
Hector walks out of the palace and into the nearby forest. He comes to the old familiar tree and claps. There is static. "Radigan?" he calls, longingly.
There is no answer.
"Oh, Radigan?" he calls once more.
"Prince Hector...is it really you...crawling back to me after all of these years?" Radigan's voice answers from very far away.
"Yes indeed. I know I said after our last 'business venture' that I'd contact you soon, but i haven't really come across any attractive conquests...until recently."
There is no answer from deep inside the tree. Prince Hector wonders if Radigan lost his connection to it.
Finally: "I'm listening..."
"You're at war with King Edward correct?"
"Yes," Radigan answers, his interest aroused.
"I want his daughter to be my wife...yet she's been slightly hesitant."
"You want me to help you and-"
"In return, I'll help you." Hector finishes.
Prince Hector smiles.
"Why the great rush on your marriage, Prince Hector?" Radigan asks.
"I must have a child as soon as possible...so that my name can live on after i..."
"Prince Hector! No...my friend!" Radigan is silent. "Prince Hector, count me in on this deal. And...if you do prove victorious in the defeat of King Edward...i can see to it that you live."
"I will be victorious, my old friend. But first...I need a way in their lives..."
1312.title: Prince Hector: The Businessman

132.content:
Isabelle had not left her chambers nor had contact with anyone since the conference with her father and his advisors. She had been laying on her bed with her hands under her head staring up at the ceiling contemplating what she should do when there came a little popping sound.

Isabelle quickly shot straight up in bed and looked around, but when she saw nothing there she recommenced her staring contest with the ceiling. Just then she grabbed her hand feeling that something had just bitten her. Once again Isabelle surveyed her chambers and found nothing in sight. Right as she was about to lay back down upon her bed a stone flew through her open window and nicked her in the side of her head.

"Ow!"

"Isabelle," a voice called from somewhere below her window. "Isabelle, its Daniel. I am in dire need of your advice. Please, Isabelle, I need to speak with you." She rose from her bed and walked over to her window and looked out.

"Daniel, what is it? What can possibly be so urgent that you would call upon me at such a late hour?"

"Please Isabelle, come down here. What I have to say is best not shouted up to you for anyone to hear." With that Daniel stepped out of Isabelle's view. Not wanting to speak with any of the servants or her parents, Isabelle carefully and quietly made her way out into the yard. She finally found Daniel standing beneath the old oak tree, that as children they had, much to her parents' disapproval, climbed on many ocassions.

"Now Daniel, what is so important that," Isabelle started but was immediately silenced when Daniel turned to face her. His clothes were torn and filthy, his hair unkempt, and his face, atleast the parts not covered in filth, was extremely pale. "Whats wrong Daniel? What happened?"

"My father is dead Isabelle. I do not know what happened, so please do not ask. This afternoon I fell asleep under this very tree, and when I awoke I was at home in my bed. The house was silent as the grave and in complete disarray - bits of furniture littered the floor. As I was searching for my mother I peered into my parents' bedchamber. In there I found my father, or rather his rancid corpse. He's dead Isabelle, stabbed through the heart. I don't know what to do." Isabelle was speakless. She opened her mouth to speak several times, but closed it deciding against it. After a few moments she found her voice again.

"Daniel, we have to tell my parents. They'll understand. We'll find whoever did this. We-"

"No Isabelle," Daniel interrupted her. "I can't, I will be executed. I cannot account for my whereabouts. Everyone will think I killed him. We can't tell anyone. I believe the best thing for me, for everyone, would be if I just left, tonight."

"Well, if you're going, then so am I."

"No Isabelle you can't. I won't let you."

"Either we tell my parents or we leave together. Its up to you."
132.title: Midnight Rendezvous

1321.content:
"Isabelle, I really don't believe you should come with me," Daniel insisted. Isabelle merely crossed her arms across her chest, her mind made up. "I suppose I won't be able to change your mind will I? Okay, but we have to leave tonight."

"Ok, just let me go get some things." She turned around to go but inside, but Daniel grabbed her arm to stop her.

"No, we don't have time, besides, someone might see you. I've already grabbed some things and some money, anything else we may need we can pick up on the way." With that and one last look at the castle, the two walked off arm in arm.

~*~*~*~the next morning at the castle~*~*~*~

"Someone please help me!" a disheveled woman on the verge of tears screamed as she ran through the doors of the castle. "Please, my husband is dead and my son is missing. Please, help."

"Madam please, calm yourself," a passing nobleman tried to calm her. Just then her Majesty the Queen was passing by and recognized the hysterical woman.

"Melinda? Is that you? Whats wrong?" she asked as she went to comfort the woman now openly weeping.

"Oh your Majesty. Howard's dead. I was in town with my daughters all of yesterday and we only returned early this morning. The scene was horrifying. He's been killed, and Daniel is missing. He must have found his father and gone off somewhere. Please, he and your daughter are friends, does she know where he has gone? Please, I am out of my mind with worry," she cried hysterically.

"It's alright Melinda. We will get all this sorted out." Then to her servant, "Run and fetch my daughter immediately. Have her meet me in my chambers." Wrapping her arm around Melinda's shoulders leading her away she said, "Isabelle will tell us if she has any information about your son's whereabouts."

"Thank you, thank you so very much your Majesty." When they reached the Queen's chambers they found a servant staring down at the floor but no Isabelle.

"Where is my daughter?"

"I'm so sorry your Majesty, but I could not find her," she replied, refusing to look the Queen in the eyes. "I looked, and I asked the other servants, but she is not in any of her usual places, or any unusual." With that she bowed and backed out of the room leaving the Queen and Daniel's mother in shock and wonder.

~*~*~*~with Daniel and Isabelle~*~*~*~

Still walking along a road with trees on either side arm in arm with Isabelle resting her head on Daniel's shoulder, Isabelle breaks the silence and asks the obvious question, "Daniel?"

"Yes?"

"Where are we going to go?" He thought for a moment but did not respond. "Daniel?"

"Honestly Isabelle, I have no clue."

"Well, I don't really mind where we go. I enjoy looking at all this beautiful scenery, but would you mind if we stop somewhere soon. We left in the middle of the night and haven't stopped walking since, and I'm getting awfully tired."
1321.title: On Their Way

13211.content:
Daniel ubruptly stops and turns to face Isabelle. With a gaze of stone, he says "Yes, your highness. I know how your dainty feet are not built for such a trek as this".

When he sees the look of shock on her face, his resolve crumbles. "I'm sorry Isabelle. That was an evil thing for me to say. It's just that on my own I would have been able to leave quietly without anyone caring except my mother. But with you along, the whole kingdom will be searching for us. If we are caught, I will most likely by executed for kidnapping."

These thoughts never registered in Isabelle's mind. While trying to help out a friend, she has become a burden. Her eyes grow moist as she realizes the mess she has caused.

Not knowing the reason of her tears, Daniel is distraught that he caused her pain. "Truly, I did not mean those vile words. I have always cherished the time we have together. If today be my last day in this land, then I will die happy"

"No you won't!" she cries. "I could never go on living without you. Why do you think I came along? Let us hurry. You are right, my father will send every knight at his disposal to track us down. The farther away we are, the better chance we have to escape the web of searchers."

With that she grabs his hand and pulls him down the path. They use the light of the stars to guide their steps until the sun appears upon the horizon.
13211.title: Royal Burden

choices: they take him with them, to the next town at least
they leave him, maybe closer to the road, so someone better may find him
13212.content:
They stopped and sat down on a fallen tree. Isabelle sat with her knees on her legs, her chin resting on her hands, and her eyes closed. Daniel had his hands on either side of him on the log, his head leaning back, and his eyes to the sky. Both merely sat there, content, for not, to rest and listen to their surroundings.

~*~*~*~*~*~
"Rest little ones. You will need it for all you will soon face. Without even knowing it, you will do my bidding and hand your precious kingdom to me. Straight into my hands I will direct your path, and there is nothing you can do about it," a cloaked figure watches their every move in a swirling cloud of mist in a cold, dark, and damp room a long distance away.
~*~*~*~*~*~

"I just don't know what happened. I fell asleep under the tree, how did I end up at home? What happened to my father?" Daniel appeared to be speaking to the sky.

"Perhaps you were sleepwalking," Isabelle opened her eyes and turned to look at Daniel, "but you did nothing wrong. We will learn the truth of what has past. You need not fear. Do you remember when we fooled the physicians? You complained of lost time, spinning, itching, and several other symptoms. Laying in bed and moaning, mud and smashed berries on your face and body, and the physicians unable to determine what ailed you. I would sit by your bed concerned, and when they left the room, the laughs we had."

"Eventually they told our parents that I would not last long." Daniel smiled, still gazing toward the heavens. "How wonderful it was to see their surprise when one morning I walked ouside perfectly healthy and we went to play."

"Such fun we had."

"We still have a lot of fun."

"But not nearly as much. My parents always have me attend all those balls and banquets, and you have much more responsibilities than before."

"Do not fret Isabelle. We will make time for fun." Isabelle joined Daniel in looking at the sky and imagining shapes and figures in the clouds. A few moments had passed when a sound was heard in the meadow on the other side or the road. It sounded familiar, but neither was sure of what it was. They rose and carefully made their way into the meadow.

"What do you suppose it is Daniel."

"I do not know. It does not sound menacing. I know I have heard that sound before." Their pace slowed as they before searching to ground for the source of the noise. Suddenly Daniel stopped and stared at something before his feet. Seeing this, Isabelle joined him at his side.

"Why, it's a baby."

"I can see that Daniel, and he's crying. Don't just stand there staring, pick him up."

"But-"

"It's just a baby Daniel, he won't hurt you." Daniel kneeled and took the baby in his arms. He was wrapped in a blanket, and Isabelle saw a piece of paper sticking out of the folds. She grabbed the paper and read the messege.

"Please care for and love this child. He is alone in this world. His name is Gregory."
13212.title: Gregory

choices: the towns people find them there
they talk with Nora awhile longer
132121.content:
"Oh Daniel, he's been abandoned. We can't just leave him here, we have to take him with us." Daniel knew it would be harder to travel with a baby, but he also knew - having lived with four women and only one man his whole life - that there was just no arguing with a woman when it came to anything maternal, or feminine for that matter.

"Alright, but when it gets too dangerous, too hard, we have to give him away. You have to be willing to give him up when the time comes."

"I'll be ready to do what is best for him. We should be going now. The sooner we go, the sooner we will arrive at whereever it is we choose to go." Daniel smiled as Isabelle brushed her nose against Gregory's, bringing for a coo of joy from the infant, and held him close. While they walked down the road to an unknown destination, both forgot of the painful event that lay behind them. Isabelle hardly took her eyes from the baby, who after looking around for awhile was content merely to sleep in Isabelle's arms. Daniel was surprised at how well Isabelle handle Gregory, neither of them had every had to care for a baby alone (his sisters were younger than them, but not that young). Maternal instinct, a woman's touch I suppose he thought to himself. He watched the few scattered trees pass by and the meadows on either side of the road, and his mind was clear of all thoughts of his father and what was to become of him, only aware of his surroundings and nothing more.

Gregory in her arms and the peaceful environment around her, Isabelle forgot of any exhaustion she previously felt, as if this sleeping baby had rejuvenated her, given her energy. Why would someone abandon this little baby? It surprised even Isabelle that, judging Gregory's reaction to her, she was fairing well at handling him.

It was another half hour before they saw a town before them, a quaint, friendly looking place. They had been walking all night and this looked like a good place to gather some supplies and rest. The sun had risen above the horizon, but only just. Isabelle hoped it would not be too early to go calling on complete strangers in their homes.

"It looks as if someone is awake in that house," Daniel pointed to the house closest to them, there was smoking coming from the chimney. "Shall we see if they will help us?"

"Gregory is in need of some milk and clothes." They walked to the front door of the medium sized cottage; Isabelle held Gregory closer to herself. Daniel knocked on the door, and in a moment it opened revealing a tall, rather lanky woman with red hair barely falling to her shoulders and a face filled with freckles.

"Why hello there little ones. How are you this morning?"

"We are well, thank you." Daniel responded. "We have been travelling most of the night and would be much obliged if you might allow us to rest here for a short while, and maybe supply us with something to eat."

"Oh of course. How could I say no to those faces, and a baby. Come on in." She led them into the kitchen and they sat down at the table while she took the pot of soup out of the fireplace.

"We really appreciate this..."

"Nora. It is no trouble my dear, I always prepare extra food. He really looks like the two of you."

"Who does?" Daniel asked.

"Your son of course."

"Oh he's not are son," Isabelle interjected. "Actually, we've only just found him along the road with a note saying that he was alone and to care for him."

"How kind of you to take him in. You say you found him near by?" They nodded. "Now that I think about it, he does bare a resemblence to Franklin and Amelia. What is his name?"

"The note said Gregory."

"Then it is their son."

"You know his parents? Do you know where we can find them, so we can return him to them?" Daniel asked, Isabelle was looking at the sleeping babe in her arms.

"I'm afraid they have passed away. Young Gregory has no one. They used to live in this town. Franklin was killed in a dispute between another town right before Gregory was born, Amelia died in child birth. Several instances led the town to believe the young infant was possessed by a demon or something along those lines. Eventually the towns people were no longer willing to keep this child within its borders. Someone took him from the town, to save him from the people. Whoever it was, they must have left him along the road hoping some kind people would find and raise him."

"How horrible."
132121.title: A Woman's Touch

1321212.content:
Nora served them each a bowl of soup and Isabelle fed some of her soup to Gregory, who was now awake and quietly looking around. When they had all finished their soup and Gregory had once again fallen asleep, they resumed their conversation.

"Now, my dears," Nora advised them, "I would suggest that if anyone asks, you tell them that the two of you are married and that Gregory is your own child. If the people of this town discovered that he is the son of Franklin and Amelia the consequences would not turn out well for either you or him. Perhaps you could say you are all siblings, but more than likely your situation would be taken advantage of and you would be put to work doing lord knows what."

~*~*~*~*~*~
"We will do all that we can to bring the princess back safely your majesty." In front of the horse pen five knights knelt to King Edward on horseback before them.

"I trust you will do so, swiftly, while maintaining order among the people. Also, young Daniel's father is dead, so he may be reluctant to return. We all want to believe that Daniel is innocent, but alas, a man is dead and his killer is out there somewhere, it may even be Daniel. Caution is the key. The life of a princess is a very precious barganing tool, and though we are at peace with most of the neighboring kingdoms I would prefer not to give them any indication that they may be able to gain an advantage over me. Especially be wary and keep your eyes open, for Radigan is a powerful sorcerer and he has on many occasions given us reason to believe he wishes to claim our land as his own by any means necessary."
~*~*~*~*~*~
"Melinda," in one of the many guest rooms within the walls of the castle Queen Jasmine tried to comfort Daniel's worry stricken mother, "Edward is sending his best knights to find them. Soon our children will be in our arms once again. In the meantime your daughters are overjoyed to be staying in the castle, you will all be safe and well cared for."

"Oh your majesty, who would wish to harm my Howard? And Daniel, to have found his father...." What if he who has taken my Howard from me now seeks to take my Daniel as well?
~*~*~*~*~*~

Isabelle walked around Nora's kitchen trying to soothe the screaming Gregory. "I do not know what is wrong. He has been fed, burped, he has slept, he does not need to be cleaned."

"Let me take a look my dear." Nora looked up from the bag she was filling with supplies for them. She checked Gregory's forehead, neck, chest, and finally his mouth. Using her thumb and index finger to hold his mouth open, Nora saw a baby tooth and sighed in acknowledgement.

"He has a tooth, what does that mean?" Daniel asked as he stood from the table to take Gregory from Isabelle's tired arms.

"Yes, he has a tooth, and many more on the way. The child is teething; his tooth and gums are in pain." She walked to the far wall and began rummaging through one of the shelves. When she turned around with jar in hand. "Here, take this. These are strips of dried goat meat. They are not very filling, but chewing on them will ease the pain." She took one strip from the jar and handed it to Daniel, who gave it to Gregory to chew on, quickly silencing his cries, before placing it in the bag. Just as Daniel and Isabelle resumed their seats at the table and sound knock came from the door. They looked at each other worriedly, but Nora merely smiled and went to answer, they carefully followed behind.
1321212.title: Nora Knows Best

choices: Daniel and Isabelle go on their way
One of Radigan's minions attacks the town
13212121.content:
Nora opened the door to reveal a little girl with long curly blonde hair no older than nine. "Nora! Nora, come quick, please," she cried looking extremely distraught.

"What is the matter Mary? What has happened?"

"My daddy, he's hurt. You have to help him. Hurry." She ran from the door out onto the lawn where they could now see a middle aged man collapsed on the ground appearing quite beat up.

Nora looked back to Daniel and Isabelle and with some urgency in her voice told them that there was bag under the table and asked if one of them would quickly go and fetch it. Daniel gently handed Gregory to Isabelle and went to get the bag. Isabelle followed Nora out to the wounded gentleman. Mary was kneeling over her father crying and begging him to be ok. After Nora sat down beside the man and began examining his wounds Mary stood and took a few steps back. Shortly Daniel emerged from the house with a large bag in his arms. He set it down next to Nora who immediately began rummaging through. Young Mary turned around and seemed to be about to run away when she stumbled and collapse into Daniel's arms. He was surprised at first, but when she began weeping he just stroked her hair and tried to comfort her.

Gregory soon fell asleep and Isabelle decided to put him down in the house for a nap. She thought it would be best if Mary was not present while Nora worked on her father; so she gently took Mary's hand and led her inside. Daniel stayed behind ready to offer any aid Nora needed.

For about ten minutes Nora worked nonstop before finally repacking her bag and standing. "Could you please help me carry him into the house?" she asked of Daniel.

"Of course." Together they lifted the man and carried him into Nora's room where they tucked him into bed. Daniel went to look for Isabelle while Nora checked on the man again and sat with him awhile. When he came out into the living room he found Isabelle sitting on a large soft rug with Gregory sleeping soundly beside her and Mary laying with her head in Isabelle's lap also sleeping. Daniel sat on the otherside of Isabelle and they comfortably sat in silence until Nora came in. They heard her come in and looked to her face silently asking a question. She smiled in answer and Isabelle tenderly woke Mary.

"Mary, your father will be just fine. He is awake now, you can go see him," Nora said. Mary sleeping rose, smiled, then ran to go see her father. "If you could not tell, I am a kind of medicine woman here, a doctor. The townspeople look to me when they feel ill or when their children get hurt or when they want a miracle drug to make them smarter, prettier, or wealthier. Walter, Mary's father, told me that he was out for a walk, he had walked quite a ways from town when he was attacked by some ungodly creature. From how he describes the creature I can only assume it to be one of the servants of that monster Radigan. He gets bolder by the day, soon he will attack the castle itself." This made Daniel and Isabelle a little uneasy just thinking that the place they called home for so long may be attacked some day soon and that Radigan's minions were so close.

"That reminds me my dears, you look remarkably similar to the young Princess Isabelle. Oh my, we've spent all this time together and I never even realized that I do not know your names."

"We have forgotten our manners Nora, not introducing ourselves after you have been so kind. And you are not the first to tell me how much I resemble the princess. I suppose it doesn't help that we have the same name either. I am Isabelle."

"I am Daniel."

"Now that we have been properly introduced, how long will you two be staying?"

"Actually, I think it would be best if we let before dark." Isabelle looked at Daniel curious as to why he felt they should leave so soon, but when he looked at her she realized that they were not safe with Radigan's servants so near. They would just have to keep on moving, else Radigan get his hands on her. "We have a lot of travelling to do, and the sooner we set off, the sooner we shall reach our destination," Daniel concluded. Though it is still unknown even to us, he thought to himself.
13212121.title: Belated Introductions

choices: Daniel searches a wooded area for his Mom.
The knife looks familiar to the inspector.
Isabelle hears a noise on her way home.
1322.content:
“Isabelle, I am afraid to go with you. If you must tell your parents you must do it alone. I will wait here for you. It’s the best I can do.”

“Fine, then, Daniel. I will go to the castle now and you keep low. I understand how it must feel to imagine you might be blamed for your father’s death. When you see your mother again maybe she can answer a few questions. I wonder where she is.”

“Maybe, just maybe, she had to go with whoever killed him. If that is the case then I don’t think I will be seeing her again very soon. Oh, Isabelle this is more terrible than what I first thought.”

“Fear not, Daniel, this will work out. Do you still want to wait while I go and tell my parents? I will have to think about how I am going to bring up the subject.”

“Do it at a time when they can listen without any interruptions. They will be able to advise you on how to handle the situation better that way…maybe during a meal. ”

That evening Isabelle was back at the stables ready to break the news to Daniel about what her parents had said in response to the murder.

“Daniel, are you in here,” she looked through several stalls before she’d called out.

“I’m up here in the loft. I fell asleep. I am exhausted from a night of worry and distress.” He came down the ladder and was by her side before she could respond.

She reached up and patted his shoulder out of concern for his wellbeing. “I hope you sleep better tonight. You are alone now, aren’t you? Your sisters must be with your Mom.”

“I figured as much; come on, Isabelle, tell me what your parents said to you about the murder.”

“They were greatly saddened, and wondered how you were holding up. I told them about your mother being nowhere around and they thought that odd. They are concerned about you being alone. They are going to talk to some of the servants and see if they can get them to take you in till your mother shows up, at least. Do you think that is something you would like to do? It’s much better than staying by yourself. They are also going to get someone over to your house to dispose of your father’s body. They figure you might need someone to help you this way. Is that right?”

“Tell you parents I am grateful for their help. I guess that would make it easier.”

“They are also going to send the police to inspect the body and see if they can find out who did this to your father.”

Daniel didn’t want to go to his house again until his mother and sisters came home. It was too weird for him to be there where his father was killed. Besides, he needed to see if he could hunt down his family.
1322.title: Tell the king and queen

choices: Isabelle heads to the castle to clean up.
Isabelle hops on a horse to continue with the plans of a race.
Isabelle decides to run away from it all - for good.
14.content:
"Isabelle!"

Daniel and Isabelle turned toward the voice beckoning the princess.

"Oh, great, it's mom," Isabelle groaned. "I think there's supposed to be a tea today. She rolled her eyes.

When Queen Jasmine discovered her daughter missing, she intuitively knew where she would be. She spent much too much time with that stable boy, handsome and sweet as he was. When would she mature enough to accept her responsibility as a princess?

"Heaven sakes, child!" Jasmine exclaimed upon entering the stable. "You look more like a prince than a princess in those cloths, not that a prince should ever let himself get so dirty. We are hosting a tea for noblemen's wives in an hour and a half, and I will need you looking your best." Jasmine turned her attention to Daniel. During her little tirade, he had dropped to one knee and respectfully stared at the ground. "Daniel, please take some responsibility for her duties as a princess since she obviously won't. She might actually listen to you."

Now Queen Jasmine loved her Isabelle immensely, and it was for this reason that she was often hard on her daughter. Isabelle knew this, and listened to her mothers words with what bit of patience she could muster up.

The Queen walked away, expecting her words to be obeyed.
14.title: Interruption

choices: Isabelle goes with Daniel and forgets who she is.
King Edward finds Isabells in the castle treasure cove.
141.content:
After Isabelle departed Daniel fell into a trance; the evil sorcerer Radigan found him an easy target to do as he bid.

Isabelle began to walk toward the castle but changed her mind. She turned around and climbed down a steep embankment to a path below. She found it a pleasant path, one that bore a smooth walking surface.

Little did she realize that she had embarked upon a journey by way of a path that never existed before that very hour. She liked the journey so well that she never questioned her surroundings.

She walked for a number of steps before she felt the pull upon her conscience ease; she had been a bit anxious when she realized that she had actually turned away from obedience to indulge her desire.

However after only a short while she could continue her adventure without the slightest hint of doing wrong.

The path led her to an adorable cottage. She desired to go inside so she entered by way of the nicely carved and brightly painted door at the front of the dwelling.

It was a few minutes before her eyes adjusted to the dim light inside. A voice stirred curiosity within her and, she strained to hear the voice again.

“Daniel,” she called out, “is that you, Daniel?”

It was Daniel; he was transformed to the cottage so that Radigan could get the information he desired through deceit and plodding against the Kings trusted daughter.

“Isabelle, it is me. I have wanted to talk with you for some time now…can you help me with a problem?”

“I guess I have time. I found this cottage along the path and it looked so inviting that I just had to stop and rest awhile.”

“Isabelle, I need to know if you will bring me something from your father? You will have to be careful and not let him know about it. Do you think you can do this for me? My life depends upon this item you must fetch.”

“I don’t know, Daniel, I can’t betray my father and mother, if that is what you are asking me.”

“No, that is not my wish.”

Isabelle turned at that moment for she felt coldness running along her back side…
141.title: Isabelle heads to the castle to clean up.

forget it. just get on the stupid horse.
142.content:
Isabelle smiled and uncrossed her fingers behind her back. Then she remounted her splenid white horse, who had been staring down at his muddy hooves in disgust.
"c'mon, Daniel," she said, trotted her horse around him impatiently. "let's race!"
Daniel sighed and pushed himself back on his feet. he loved Isabelle's personality and didn't want her to change, yet...
"c'mon!get on your horse!"
"really, Isabelle. you should follow your mother's words," he said.
"Don't give me that," Isabelle sighed, stopping her horse.

"Just get on the horse."

142.title: Disobedience

choices: Bernard gives him a fitting punishment
1422.content:
Daniel realizes the futility in protesting any further. As he mounts his horse, Isabelle kicks her steed to gain a head start. Daniel spus his own beast on and quickly catches up. For an hour they merrily ride through the paths around the castle. There is never any danger as the knights guard the area, knowing the heir to the throne enjoys the freedom a daily ride allows her.

When they return to the stables, Daniel emplore her to get ready for tea, as she doesn't have much time left. Feeling a bit guilty, Isabelle hurries off.

"That is not the way to become a knight" comes a voice from the far corner of the stables. As a startled Daniel turns he sees Bernard step out of the shadows. "You should never disobey a direct order from the crown. I know you are fond of the princess but she does not yet sit on the throne."

Daniel drops his head in shame. The noble man standing before him is the only reason he has a chance in becoming a knight. Nine years ago Bernard was merely a traveling sell-sword. While visiting the kingdom, he witnessed Daniel's father beating the boy in the center of the village. The other peasants merely looked the other way but he could not. By just placing his hand on the hilt of his sword he dissuaded the evil man from landing another blow. Bernard knew that he only delayed the inevitable. Once his boots hit the dirt path leading out of the village, the man would continue pummeling his boy until he was dead. It was on that day he forsake his wandrelust and pledged his loyalty to King Edward. He visited daniel as often as his duties allowed until he was able to convince the boy to become a squire. Spending most of the day at the castle erased most of Daniel's bruises, but occasionally new ones would appear. The day the young squire finally joins him as a defender of the crown would herald the end of his suffering.

Knowing that he had disappointed his mentor greatly, Daniel quietly said "My apologies, Sir Bernard. There is no excuse for my actions. Any actions you feel neccisary will be just."
1422.title: To Become A Knight

choices: Later, the princess wants to go for another ride
He decides to talk with Isabelle about it
14222.content:
Bernard sighed and folded his arms across his chest. “Daniel, why do you let her do this to you?”

Daniel remained kneeling as he spoke. “She’s my friend sir, and she’s stubborn.” Daniel risked a glance up and found a small smile cracking Bernard’s otherwise grim face.

“Yes she is at that isn’t she.” The smile vanished as Bernard continued. “All right, friends stick together and help one another right?” The boy nodded so the knight continued. “Friends also tell one another when they are wrong.” Now Daniel did look up, confusion written all over his features. “When our young princess does become Queen she is going to need a friend she can trust not only to be there for her, but to also tell her when she is mistaken. The King and Queen both trust the knights to stand united in public. However in private we are encouraged to voice our own opinions. This helps them to rule more effectively as we can gently point out when they may be taking a bad course of action.”

Daniel paused working that through his mind for several moments, trying to see what his mentor was driving at. Then it hit him. “I have to have the ability to tell her when she is doing something she shouldn’t, don’t I.” a satisfied smile spread across his mentors lips.

“Yes Daniel, when she shirks her duties you have to be the one to gently remind her of what she should do.” Bernard motioned for the youth the rise, which he did. “She can not think that she is free to do whatever crosses her mind. That is not the job of royalty. However she is young and youth likes to run free, you need to be there to help guide her back when she goes a stray.” Bernard turned to go. “Just give it some thought today okay?” Daniel nodded and his mentor strode away.

Daniel sat down, his mind awash with thoughts as he considered the Knights words.
14222.title: What does it mean to be a real friend

143.content:
Isabelle ran a muddy hand through her tangled hair, sighing a well-used sigh. She was tired of it all. She was tired of always having to look neat and 'presentable'. She was tired of being reprimanded for spending time with the only friend she actually liked. She was tired of being a princess!
"I can't do it anymore," she murmured, gazing down at her filthy jeans with a sad smile. An idea began to spread through her quick, clever mind. It would be simple - before supper the halls were empty. Just as the bell would ring she'd leave, away from her restricting life and parents. Off and away on her fastest horse, Daniel beside her. It would be brilliant; they could go anywhere, do anything. She smiled a proper, Isabelle-ish grin, and ran out to the stables.

* * *

Daniel was not in the stables, nor was in the fields. As Isabelle approached the only remaining place he could be hiding in, she realised something which made her shiver. Daniel couldn't possibly leave. He had a good job, an income. He wouldn't dare leave all that to run off with some silly spoilt princess. But... No, she was being ridiculous. Of course he would come! She was his best friend, and had been for years. He would certainly support her, whatever she did.
"Dan? You there?" She dismissed all anti-Daniel thoughts and scrambled up the tallest oak tree to her treehouse. She and Daniel often played there, although it had become rather damp and bleak.
"Dan?" Just as with her first call, there was no reply. She hoisted herself into the small treehouse...

14312.content:
Daniel fingered every thing in his treasure chest, from his sister's favorite doll she had given him before he left, his mother's silver neckalce, to his father's drawing of his favorite horse...
he sighed stared at a family potrait, ripped and tattered from travel. he kept it with him always when he went somewhere. they seemed so far away, now, on the small farms in the outskirts of the kingdom, right next the the forest. and, as always when he saw the painting, wondered if coming to the palace to train for a knight was worth leaving his family behind.
he shook his head. "Become a knight," he whispered to himself. "Protect them from the horrors in the forests..."

14312.title: Daniel's Memories
